It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.  Job duties and responsibilities are subject to change based on changing business needs and conditions.

Hi everyone. First and foremost, we want to stress that this internship provides a great learning experience to all our interns in a highly positive environment. In fact, last summer our internships were ranked #6 in the nation.

SocialTech Labs brings together passionate, creative, young individuals across the globe to help build our upcoming social media app: BestFriends, a closed social networking app promoting positivity in a magically safe place (especially helpful on difficult days) with your 5 best friends. Interns would work with other interns and teen team leaders (https://socialtechlabs.com/team/).

We are a virtual company using Skype as our primary method of day-to-day communication. In addition, we have weekly Zoom calls.

**The DT Intern Scholars Program is designed for undergraduate sophomores who self-identify as Black/African American and or Hispanic/Latinx.** The program is a multi-year experience exposing students to different roles within the tech industry. It will provide participants with knowledge and training to strengthen technical and communication skills while building business acumen and providing visibility to career opportunities. As a DT Intern Scholar, you will have two internship opportunities to work in a high-performing team and provide solutions to our customers’ most complex issues. Each summer, you will be assigned an innovative project where you can quickly ramp and make real contributions. Whether delivering tools / features, testing a new product, enhancing inventory management controls or working with teams that support our customers daily, you will learn what it’s like to work in a fast-pasted organization that provides leading edge solutions to customer challenges. You’ll have opportunities to interact with leaders, other summer interns and network at professional development and social events. At the end of your tenure you’ll share what you’ve accomplished. Upon successful completion of the first DT Intern Scholars internship, students may receive a second DT Scholars internship offer. Those who successfully complete all DT Scholars internships and maintain high academic achievement may receive full-time job offers. **Program Internship Offerings** DT Intern Scholars internship roles are available across several of Dell’s business units within the Products and Operations organization. We offer internships in 5 areas and details can be found below. **1. Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG): Engineering Intern **(Internship locations: Austin, TX; Hopkinton, MA; Santa Clara, CA; Seattle, WA, Remote) ++What You’ll Do++: The Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG) at Dell Technologies delivers the essential infrastructure for organizations to build their digital future, transform IT from core to cloud to edge and protect their most important asset: information! As an ISG Engineering Intern, you will focus on the future needs of our business and our customers through a communities of practice internship model. You and your intern team will drive an end to end project connected towards one of our community themes, with support from a project lead, community members and subject matter experts in the business. ++Who You Are++: Working towards a Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Technology related degree | Understanding of Computer Science/Computer Engineering Foundations **2. Client Solutions Group: Engineering Intern** (Internship locations: Austin, TX; Hopkinton, MA, Remote) ++What You’ll Do++: Deliver the essential commercial, consumer, gaming and software solutions to individuals and organization across the globe and offer great opportunities to deliver innovation across cloud services, security, hardware, and software solutions. As a Software Engineering Intern, you will innovate, design, implement and debug modules and infrastructure created for our next generation product offering. ++Who You Are++: Working towards a Bachelor’s degree in the following Majors- ME, Thermal, CE, EE, IT, MIS, CS, Computing or similar fields. | for Software positions you will need proficiency in at least one of C/C++/Java/JavaScript/ Python/Node.js | Hands-on implementation experience in data structures, algorithms, and OS | Working knowledge of Linux systems, distributed systems, and cloud-related environments | For Hardware you will need proficiency in any of the design software: Creo, Fusion, ANSYS, and/or Flotherm XT/Flotherm computational fluid dynamics simulation software. (Equivalent tool experience is acceptable) **3. Client Solutions Group: Marketing Intern** (Internship locations: Round Rock, TX, Remote) ++What You’ll Do++: Gain real Marketing business experience and get project-based roles throughout North America Marketing Operations (COC) organization. Develop project plans/schedules, define project requirements, manage communications, and report on project status. ++Who You Are++: Working towards a Bachelor’s degree with concentration in Marketing, Business Administration, Business Management, Economics, Business Analytics, Finance or other related discipline. **4. Client Solutions Group: Sales Intern** (Internship locations: Round Rock, TX, Remote) ++What You’ll Do++: Support a key business initiative for our inside sales team and work with Inside Sales Managers and Director on a special project that will impact the organization. ++Who You Are++: Working towards a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Business Management, or other related discipline | Strong Organizational, analytical, problem solving, negotiation, and planning skills | Experience with Excel, PowerPoint is a plus. **5. Global Operations/Supply Chain Intern** (Internship locations: Austin, TX or Hopkinton, MA, Remote) ++What You’ll Do++: Join a world-class Global Operations supply chain where you can drive lasting change while building a long-term career. Interns work in different areas (e.g., procurement, manufacturing & operations, logistics) of Global Operations and all interns are expected to complete analysis and present results / recommendations to management on summer projects. ++Who You Are++: Working towards a Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Industrial and Systems Engineering or applicable field.

position: Intern - Data Scientist - Summer 2022- CO or Nationwide
description: ABOUT LUMEN Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies. THE ROLE Lumen’s Internship Program is a path for career readiness in the 4th Industrial Revolution.  Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology.  During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time.  Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. The Experience  -    Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems  -    Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects -    Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. -    Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves. THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES As a Data Scientist in our North America Operations organization, the Intern will work to develop and program methods, automated processes, and systems to cleanse, integrate and analyze structured and unstructured, diverse “big data” sources to generate actionable insights and solutions using machine learning and advanced analytics. Tasks during the 10 weeks will include researching and crunching data to assist with system automation. The ideal intern will have technical skills with common languages in the industry.  You will need a high level of engagement and ability to take initiative, ask questions and work in a team environment. -    Interprets and communicates insights and findings from analyses and experiments to other analysts, data scientists, team members and business partners.  -    Design working models and implement them on Big Data systems using Map Reduce or Spark frameworks. -    Assist with operationalizing the solutions and changing business processes to maximize the value of those solutions.  -    Identify patterns and leverage information discovered to create a more automated environment  WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE - EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS  -    Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, rising senior or master’s level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – May 2023. -    Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Machine learning, Advanced Analytics, or similar technical degree field. -    PROFICIENCY AND UNDERSTANDING OF: -    Able to apply techniques such as classification, clustering, regression, deep learning, association, anomaly detection, time series forecasting, Hidden Markov models and Bayesian inference to solve pragmatic business problems -    Basic Experience with big data systems and basic programming languages -    Familiar with Hadoop, Pig, Hive, Scope, Cosmos, or similar technologies. -    Experience with statistical programming environments like Python, R, SPSS or IBM Watson Studio  -    Fluent in one or more object oriented-languages like C#, C++, Scala, Java, and scripting languages like Python or Ruby   -    Experience with PowerBI and sparking graphs -    PROFESSIONAL ATTRIBUTES  -    Strong self-drive for results and taking initiative -    Ability to show and present on data -    Comfort in speaking to those in leadership roles -    Strong ability to analyze -    Ability to be resourceful and adaptable -    Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions -    Strong written and verbal communication skills -    Ability to interact with business partners and drive the conversation -    Self driven-works with minimal supervision -    Flexible and adapts well to change -    WORK SETTING -    Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Broomfield -CO, Littleton-CO,  or may consider remote/ work from home. -    Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours per week during the 10-week program (June – August) -    Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations) -    US work authorization  WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you! Job Description: The software development intern will work directly with our professional app developers and assist with a wide variety of projects as it relates to the TurnUp mobile and web app. The intern will report directly to members of our app development team.

TurnUp is looking for a few software engineering volunteers to contribute to our mobile and web app and help on a few other initiatives.

Interns will learn about progressive organizing, start-ups, partnerships, marketing, and about the non-profit, civic technology and progressive space.

If you possess any of the requirements below, we are very excited to hear from you, but it is not required that you possess one of these: * 1+ years of software development experience in a javascript heavy environment * 1+ years of experience with react-native, react-bootstrap, or react * 1+ years of experience in developing firebase functions in javascript or typescript * 1+ Experience in software architecture, planning and management * 1+ years of test engineering experience with of the following: mocha, jest, or similar * 1+ years of experience in developing RESTful APIs (preferably in javascript)

Here is some information about TurnUp:

At TurnUp (www.turnup.us), we are a collaborative workspace that believes in the power that young people can have when they are civically engaged. We believe that everyone should be able to access their activist potential, and that communication creates power. We hope to make the world just, fair and equitable for all, by engaging young people in our democracy.

This is an unpaid internship.

Interns will have the opportunity to work remotely and interact with the nonprofit technology community. Interns will have access to our illustrious advisory board, and make a real impact on youth voter turnout to further progressive change. Time commitment is negotiable.

Marine Science & Education Virtual/Remote Internship

Our team focuses on ecological restoration, community engagement, and research that ultimately protects our waterways and coastal environments. Historically, we have run field trips and volunteer days in the Gloucester area and performed a series of field projects including plastic and invasive mitigation, sea level rise data collection, and others.  In the face of the COVID-19 pandemic, we have implemented more virtual programming to involve our community in a meaningful and safe way. The ideal MS&E intern should be passionate about sustainability and knowledgeable about current issues related to our environment.

MS&E initiatives include: creating educational materials to facilitate citizen science, assisting in research for the Chebacco Lake restoration work, mitigating marine debris via various initiatives, collaborating with other Seaside teams, and more!

Desired skills: 

Outstanding writing and communication skills
Ability to work in a collaborative and interpersonal environment 
Must be able to perform literature reviews and extensive research into a wide range of topics
Should be able to organize and write about advanced scientific information for the general public 
Knowledge of how and when to cite sources (APA preferred)

Desired experience include: 

Research (preferably in STEM) 
Performance of scientific literature reviews and interaction with academic publications
Courses in environmental science, sustainability, or environmental justice 
Jobs in sustainability
Experience creating educational materials for children
ArcGIS experience is a bonus!

++**Who we are and what we do**++ Momentive (NASDAQ: MNTV) (formerly SurveyMonkey) is a leader in agile experience management, delivering powerful, purpose-built solutions that bring together the best parts of humanity and technology to redefine AI. Momentive products, including [++GetFeedback++](https://www.getfeedback.com/), [++SurveyMonkey++](https://www.momentive.ai/?ut_source2=en%2Fcareers%2F3479904-software-engineer&ut_source3=inline), and its [++brand and market insights++](https://www.momentive.ai/insights/?ut_source2=en%2Fcareers%2F3479904-software-engineer&ut_source3=inline) solutions, empower decision-makers at 345,000 organizations worldwide to shape exceptional experiences. About ThorTech Solutions:

ThorTech Solutions is a software development and IT consultancy that specializes in coming up with creative solutions in the cloud, specifically AWS. We utilize new technology and techniques to enable our clients to do things today that they couldn’t do yesterday.

About the Client:

The client is a SaaS firm that provides cloud data integration and validation solutions for industries such as telecommunication, retail, and healthcare.

About the Role:

As a Clojure Developer, you’ll be responsible for software design, implementation, testing, and operation. You’ll collaborate with other software engineers, quality assurance engineers, product managers, and product designers to participate in the full software development lifecycle – from product requirements to software design to testing and release.

The team uses Clojure, Java, Python, ES6, and React. They run on AWS. Experience with these technologies is not required but is considered a plus.

2+ years experience with Clojure
Experience with programming languages such as Java and/or Python
Familiarity with basic data structures and algorithms
Knowledge of web applications, databases, Linux, and cloud environments
A track record of delivering substantial software projects in cloud or SaaS products
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Highly Desirable:

AWS Experience
Experience with other functional programming languages (Scala, Haskell, LISP, etc.)
Experience with React

Pay: $27,345.00 - $92,868.00 per year

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Multiple locations

Yes

position: Intern - Software Applications Associate - Summer 2022 - CO or Remote/Nationwide
description: ABOUT LUMEN Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies. THE ROLE Lumen’s Internship Program is a path for career readiness in the 4th Industrial Revolution.  Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology.  During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time.  Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. The Experience  -    Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems  -    Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects -    Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. -    Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves. THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES As a Software Applications Associate intern in our North American Operations organization, you will work collaboratively with our team to assess the validity of internal needs and the network's ability to fulfill the demand and provide guidance on where & how the demand can be fulfilled. This position will have high exposure to network planning and capacity management. Tasks during the 10 weeks will provide a bridge between our sales team and what our network can provide to customers. You will need a high level of engagement and ability to take initiative, ask questions, learn quickly, and work in a team environment. Other tasks may include: -    Build software tools to link API's between disparate internal systems to minimize the manual steps in the capacity management process- The software tools are intended to be working prototypes to support the business needs until an internal development team can take on a permanent, supported solution. -    Facilitate capacity check requests initiated from MySupportDesk and linked to Jira (to initiate an internal workflow) and an internal capacity check tool (to estimate traffic impacts).  -   Streamline the capacity check processes through the Compute Planning organization (accelerating large sales) and automate workload tracking in Planning  -    Continued support of Lumen's cutting edge Edge Compute (Bare Metal & Virtual Machine) and CDN services with other software development prototypes, as identified. WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE -    Education Requirements  -    Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university- rising senior status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – May 2023. -    Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Computer Science, MIS, Data Science, or related field  -    Proficiency and understanding of:  -    Microsoft Suites  -    Python -    Professional Attributes  -    Strong drive for results/solutions and taking initiative to resolve problems -    High attention to detail with STRONG organizational skills -    Enjoys working with a variety of different people -    Ability to be resourceful and adaptable- independently AND in a team environment  -    Strong written and verbal communication skills  -    Comfortability in unstructured environment  -    Flexible and able to adjust to changes -    Self-starter mindset -    Work Setting -    Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Broomfield, CO, or Remote/Work From Home -    Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June – August) -    Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations) -    US work authorization  WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you! Internship HAWAIIAN TELCOM Honolulu, HI JOB DETAILS LOCATION Honolulu, HI POSTED 4 Days Ago Promoted by HAWAIIAN TELCOM Description Job Purpose: The Outside/Inside Plant Engineering Intern will provide support to the Network Development Team. The role will involve drafting schematic, electrical and scale drawings for engineer job plans and specifications. Duties may also include updating databases, developing and updating provisioning sheets, and site walks with an HT engineer to validate poles, pull boxes, utility holes, and addresses. Frequent interaction with Planning and Engineering is required to coordinate related work activities. Performs other related, marginal duties associated with engineering as needed. Essential Functions Assist Engineers with projects while learning the workflow process of day to day engineering. Perform all aspects of technical deployment projects, including an implementation plan, methods of procedures, additional technical resource identification, and execution of work. 50% Develop/modify provisioning sheets, graphs, and charts as required. 10% Assist engineers with reviewing plans, tracking permit submittals, assisting with administrative functions of engineering.10% Update various databases and systems.10% Interact and communicate with planners and engineers when necessary to determine work requirements.10% Perform other related marginal duties as required.10% Qualifications Four years of High School or equivalent Must be enrolled in an Associate's, Bachelor's or Master's degree program in CAD Drafting and Design, Engineering Technology, Computer Science, or Information Sciences with a technical concentration from a two-year college or university. Completion of any one or combination of the following: drafter or architectural, mechanical, or similar drafting courses. Knowledge of TCP/IP and MPLS Networks Microsoft Office Suite: Familiar with all applications from the Microsoft Office Suite to create reports, analyze data, and present information. Ability to learn to utilize new software applications with little/no training and documentation essential. Have a valid driver's license Microsoft Office Ability to quickly learn and utilize new technologies/programming skills 2 or more of the following college course equivalents: UH written communication (FW), UH focus requirement (O, OC), social sciences (DS), or any equivalent Undergraduate students in the following disciplines (major or minor) are preferred: Business Administration, Engineering (any), Computer Science, Communication and Information Sciences, Communications Minimum GPA: 3.0/4.0

To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won't happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future. Why Work for Us Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including open work spaces and virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteer interests, and make it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities. Job Description 2022 Spring/Summer Internship This is a remote position, the selected candidate can reside and perform the work from anywhere within the United States. #LI-Remote #GeneralMotors At GM, we earn customers for life. We have a culture of building brands that inspire passion and loyalty. Therefore we've created a new group. This is an exciting area that is functioning as a startup but with the stability of a 100+ year old company. About Customer Experience: Global Customer Experience (CX) organization to focus on delivering world-class experiences to our customers. The mission of CX organization is to design and build digital products, services, and experiences for General Motors customers globally. The group will accomplish this mission by bringing together customer, brand, and competitor insights from across the enterprise and using them to design, prioritize, and build the best enterprise-wide solutions. There are variety of areas within CX and your summer internship can be based on your interest, qualifications and best fit for the business. * CX Chief Engineering Assistant Program Analyst - where you will be working with more technical teams in Engineering and IT to work cohesively in achieving an enterprise-wide customer experience vision. You will help construct, plan, and lead technical programs for products, services, and customer experience software. * System Operations Intern - where your primary responsibility is to provide analytical support to the System Vehicle team which often means pursuing independent projects and working closely with others. Here you will have responsibilities in robust quantitative analysis by manipulating data using Microsoft Excel, Oracle Database, Minitab and Hadoop data analytics. Additional Job Description Qualifications: * Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in one of the following areas: Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science, Software, or Technical Architecture * Able to work full-time, 40 hours per week * Must be Sophomore standing or higher * Ability to work in ambiguous situations * Shown capability to collaborate with different people and groups to gain trust and hit program objectives * Demonstrated learning agility Desired Skills: * Outstanding interpersonal and relationship management skills to effectively collaborate with varying levels of the organization as needed * Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to distill complex subjects to a wider audience * Emerging partnership and collaboration skills and ability to learn from and share knowledge with co-workers in a fast-paced environment * High level of integrity, ability to deal with ambiguity, take initiative/self-directed * Evidence of strong character with honesty, accountability and trust * Consistently demonstrates innovative thinking that is customer-centric This is a remote position, the selected candidate can reside and perform the work from anywhere within the United States. #LI-Remote #GeneralMotors The median level of the monthly salary compensation for this role is $4300 dependent upon class status and degree. Benefit options are not available for this role. PLEASE ONLY APPLY IF YOU DO NOT NEED SPONSORSHIP TO WORK IN THE UNITED STATES NOW OR IN THE FUTURE. WE ARE UNABLE TO CONSIDER CANDIDATES WHO REQUIRE SPONSORSHIP. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies. THE ROLE LUMEN’S INTERNSHIP PROGRAM IS A PATH FOR CAREER READINESS IN THE 4TH INDUSTRIAL REVOLUTION.   Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology.  During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time. THE EXPERIENCE - INNOVATE – to deliver solutions to real business problems - TRANSFORM – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects - CONNECT – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. - IMPACT – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.   Join Lumen's UX Team as we re-imagine and reinvent how large Telecoms can better interact with and support their customers in a way that is more modern, digital-first, intuitive, and friendly. Design user experiences used by millions of people everyday, take on complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs. Collaborate with teams of Designers, Researchers, Engineers and Product Managers throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes. At each stage, you will anticipate what our users need, advocate for them and ensure that the final product surprises and delights them. Bring your experience in Design Thinking and your pragmatic user-centered and data-informed design approach to create innovative, usable, great-looking products that people love to use.   We're looking for a UX Research Intern to help us make the performance of complex tasks an intuitive, elegant, and satisfying user experience. As part of a growing UX team you'll collaborate with multiple teams to create software for our customers that is powerful, feature-rich, yet easy to use. We value creative, self-driven individuals who care about the work they produce and the people they work with and we love a good sense of humor, too. The User Experience Research Intern will work with product design teams to identify research needs and deliver user-centered findings that help design useful, usable, and desirable user experiences.   JOB DESCRIPTION The ideal candidate for this role is a problem-solver and self-starter who effectively collaborates with other teams to deliver user-centric insights. The selected intern will help define and shape solutions that scale, using multiple research tools and techniques to uncover user insights. Your fellow researchers will provide you with support and mentorship.   RESPONSIBILITIES: - Conduct qualitative and quantitative research to help inform requirements and validate design decisions - Advocate for the user and champion the value of research as part of the decision-making process - Collaborate with our product managers, engineers, UX designers, and UX researchers to improve engagement and reduce friction across multiple digital products - Participate in multidisciplinary brainstorms, working sessions, and other collaborative discussions   WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS: - Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Communications, Psychology, Computer Science, or have other related experience. - Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university; junior or senior level education status at the start of the internship (graduating August 2022 – June 2023). PREFERRED EXPERIENCE: - Familiarity with Quantitative and Qualitative Research Methods - Have a passion for understanding and building empathy for humans - A portfolio and/or case studies demonstrating student work. - Experienced in data-gathering and analysis techniques across qualitative and quantitative methods - Able to multitask and work in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment - Excited to solve unique and challenging problems - Thrive on collaboration, working side by side with people of all backgrounds and disciplines, and have strong verbal and written communications PROFESSIONAL ATTRIBUTES: - Strong drive for results and taking initiative - Ability to be resourceful and adaptable - Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions   WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you! 2022 Summer Internship Program - Technology About IHS Markit At the heart of IHS Markit, we are an information company. Eligibility Our next internship program runs through the summer of 2022. You will see how the business and technical side of application development come together to create impactful and actionable information and how the technology is maintained and developed in order to keep it competitive in the marketplace. If you are passionate about solving challenging technical problems and have a desire to work in technology, this is the stream for you. At Freddie Mac, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation. As part of Freddie Mac’s return to the office pilot, all employees, contingent workers and visitors must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to be on-site unless they have an approved accommodation. **Position Overview:** At Freddie Mac, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation. Launch your career by doing more with us! Our internships and graduate programs give you the opportunity to tackle a variety of challenging roles and make your mark on several projects. From day one, you’ll gain confidence, see your ideas take shape and build a network of people who are invested in your success. ​​​We're not just the next step, we’re the right step! **Our Impact:** ERM’s objective is to build strong, effective and efficient risk management in order to help manage risk and capital and the largest financial institutions. ERM is responsible for independent oversight and assessment of our financial and non-financial risks. We establish and communicate the enterprise risk framework — including corporate risk policies and standards — while promoting a strong risk culture. Our internship offers you an opportunity to make meaningful contributions to the company’s risk management objectives and provides exposure to a wide spectrum of risk disciplines that will allow you to build on the knowledge and analytical skills you have acquired through your advanced studies. You will work with some of the brightest minds in the financial services industry and develop your knowledge of risk management, all while building valuable skills and making lifelong connections. Upon successful completion of the three-month internship and your advanced degree, you may be extended an opportunity to join our Enterprise Graduate Risk Rotation program – a two-year analyst rotation program that allows you to work in different risk management areas such as Credit, Market and Model risk. Our analyst program is designed to help you build a broad skill set, develop a comprehensive foundation in risk management, and accelerate your career growth by gaining exposure to Freddie Mac’s enterprise-level risk management function. **Your Impact:** **Project Support** As an intern, you will support short-term projects that contribute to division priorities, which may include one or more of the following activities: - Evaluate and monitor the portfolio against established criteria and make recommendations for maintaining current level of risk or mitigating and reducing risks - Develop, use and/or analyze quantitative models that assess the market, credit and/or operational risks of new and existing financial and mortgage products or portfolios - Monitor and analyze the organization's market risk exposure on a day-to-day and long-term basis for various financial products, monitoring trading limits and reviewing transactions over the established limits - Develop, validate or evaluate model input, methodology, implementation and output of models or analytic applications - Execute and document complex financial models - Provide model use risk assessments based on findings - Provide modeling and analytical assistance to a line of business or product area, functioning as day-to-day technical specialist - Evaluate and manage risks associated with the company's models and/or model applications - Perform model validation reviews, establishing performance thresholds, researching model approaches, or creating alternative models - Professional Development Participation in the program will support your continued professional development through access to targeted training courses and exposure to senior management. You will gain knowledge of risk management concepts in the financial industry and an understanding of critical organizational business and risk management functions, all while enhancing your own competencies, by: - Building critical leadership, business and analytical skills - Creating your personal brand and growing your internal network - Obtaining support and guidance from dedicated program managers, experienced rotational analysts and knowledgeable mentors - Participating in organized community service events to complement your professional development with personal growth **Qualifications:** - Enrolled in full-time graduate degree program or foreign equivalent in data science, applied mathematics, economics, physics, econometrics, finance, engineering, statistics, computer science or related quantitative subject area - Three to five years of professional work experience - Graduating in either December 2022 or May 2023 **Keys to Success in this Role:** - Execution focused, with proven initiative, personal accountability and leadership - Strong consultation and influencing skills - Ability to work with and collaborate within a team and across the broader organization - Ability to work independently and adapt in a changing environment - Curiosity to learn and challenge the status quo - Interest or experience in financial markets, securitization, trading of financial products, or loan and security portfolio management **Preferred Skills** - Excellent oral and written communications skills - Strong analytical skills - Experience working with large data sets - Experience with economic and/or financial modeling, including advanced econometric/statistics estimation techniques - Programming experience in Python, R, or other similar software applications - Proficient in MS Office Suite, specifically Excel and PowerPoint - Experience with Microstrategy and/or Tableau - Current Freddie Mac employees please apply through the internal career site. Today, Freddie Mac makes home possible for one in four home borrowers and is one of the largest sources of financing for multifamily housing. Join our smart, creative and dedicated team and you’ll do important work for the housing finance system and make a difference in the lives of others. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will ensure that individuals with differing abilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. Notice to External Search Firms: Freddie Mac partners with BountyJobs for contingency search business through outside firms. Resumes received outside the BountyJobs system will be considered unsolicited and Freddie Mac will not be obligated to pay a placement fee. If interested in learning more, please visit [www.BountyJobs.com](http://www.bountyjobs.com/) and register with our referral code: MAC.

During a 10- week period (June 3, 2022 - August 12, 2022),  our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time. Join CenturyLink’s UX Team as we re-imagine and reinvent how large Telecoms can better interact with and support their customers in a way that is more modern, digital-first, intuitive, and friendly. Design user experiences used by millions of people everyday, take on complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs. Collaborate with teams of Designers, Researchers, Engineers and Product Managers throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes. At each stage, you will anticipate what our users need, advocate for them and ensure that the final product surprises and delights them. Bring your experience in Design Thinking and your pragmatic user-centered and data-informed design approach to create innovative, usable, great-looking products that people love to use. OVERVIEW   We're looking for a UX Design Intern to help us make the performance of complex tasks an intuitive, elegant, and satisfying user experience. As part of a growing UX team you'll collaborate with multiple teams to create software for our customers that is powerful, feature-rich, yet easy to use. The ideal candidate is a problem-solver and self-starter who effectively collaborates with other teams to deliver user-centric design. You will create solutions that scale, using multiple tools and techniques to communicate your ideas. Your fellow designers and our user researcher will provide you with support and mentorship.   RESPONSIBILITIES:   - Creating design solutions, with deliverables such as user flows, wireframes, clickable prototypes, high-fidelity mockups and detailed design specifications - Presenting design work to fellow designers, as well as product and engineering teams, and business stakeholders - Contributing to guidelines and design standardization across a product portfolio - Incorporating customer feedback and usability findings into a design - Partnering with product and design to plan and prioritize work, resolve issues, and remove roadblocks - Planning new features, projects, and products; understanding business objectives, analyzing customer behaviors, identifying UX problems and/or unmet customer needs.     WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE   - Pursing a Bachelor's degree or higher in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science information technology, or related discipline. - Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, rising senior or master’s level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – June 2023. - Proven experience in user-centered design with hands-on experience throughout the process, from user research to developing prototypes and collaborating on implementation. - Experience in delivering wireframes, UX flows, mockups, interactive prototypes, personas, and use case development is required. - Ability and passion to understand distinct user groups quickly and distill complex needs into clean, understandable solutions. - Understanding of information architecture, design patterns, and interaction design. - Work as a member of our cross-functional team, partnering with users, product owners, business analysts, and development teams to deliver business value. - Ability to work independently, managing schedules in a dynamic, multi-project environment Familiarity and ability to promote appropriate usability testing and user research endeavors. - Experience with design and prototyping software (e.g., any of the following: Sketch, InVision, Figma, Adobe Creative Suite) - Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills - you will be expected to be able to defend design decisions in an articulate, inclusive manner, and be able to incorporate constructive criticism - Defining, managing, and prioritizing your own work, juggling multiple projects - Passion for the role of design in shaping digital experiences - Using design systems, pattern libraries, and user research to help inform design decisions WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT   After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you! MuleSoft is the leader in implementing the application network by connecting data, devices and applications, and we are pursuing people passionate about integration that enables digital transformation. The Delivery Manager interns will manage various internal project tasks and client project tasks under the guidance of an experienced MuleSoft DM. The purposes of the role are for the intern to gain experience, contribute to assigned projects and gain insights into interest in joining the Mulesoft Services team upon graduation. Below are some of the responsibilities that you will carry out in your role as DM Intern: Support MuleSoft DMs on multiple customer projects simultaneously Work closely with Delivery Manager(s) as part of the project team and provide assistance with project team/tasks management and execution Assist in the planning and management of project task executions and communicate status to all stakeholders Assist in the management of MuleSoft issues and risks, tracking and resolution Develop processes, templates, or tools as part of an internal continuous improvement team. What You'll Achieve Gain an understanding of digital transformation and professional services consulting. Real-life, hands on experience with delivering mission critical client projects impacting business and operations. Learn and experience core project management disciplines including the agile framework, risk and issue management, scheduling, tracking, budget management, and more. Complete Mulesoft training including our Mulesoft products, Catalyst methodologies for Services implementations and services offerings. Learn our Services' team internal processes for staffing and resourcing, partner engagement, and the entire lifecycle for managing Mulesoft projects. Complete training to understand the role of each Mulesoft team included in Services engagements - Customer Success, Engagement Management and Account Team. Learn the Catalyst and Center for Enablement methodology for implementing organizational change management jointly with our clients. Contribute to one or more internal projects and/or client-facing engagements Opportunities will be provided for voluntary time off (VTO) for giving back to the community. Learn and experience the unique Salesforce Ohana culture. What You'll Need to be Successful A rising senior (current junior) pursuing a Bachelor's degree with a preferred concentration in Computer Science, Management Information Systems (MIS), Information Systems, Business, or Marketing. Be able work independently and under management's direction Ability to work in a cross-functional team environment Aptitude for an operational and/or technical services role Demonstrate basic knowledge with waterfall and agile methodologies Demonstrate interest in career expansion as a project manager and/or scrum master Ability to work in collaboration with a client project manager or scrum master to lead the implementation through an entire software development lifecycle. Dynamic leadership aptitude Strong Verbal and written communication skills About MuleSoft, a Salesforce company Our mission is to help organizations change and innovate faster by making it easy to connect the world's applications, data, and devices. Companies like Spotify, McDonald's, and Unilever rely on MuleSoft to stay agile, deliver faster, and make the most of their IT investment with API-led connectivity. Hiring exceptional people who want to build a great company together is our number one priority, and we're committed to providing an equal opportunity workplace where everyone is supported and inspired to do their best work. We work tirelessly to build this culture. Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form (https://careers.mail.salesforce.com/accommodations-request-form) . Posting Statement At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com (http://salesfore.com/) or Salesforce.org . Salesforce welcomes all. Founded in 1999, Salesforce is the global leader in Customer Relationship Management (CRM). Companies of every size and industry are using Salesforce to transform their businesses, across sales, service, marketing, commerce, and more by connecting with customers in a whole new way. We harness technologies that can revolutionize companies, careers, and, hopefully, our world. Salesforce is built on a set of four core values: Trust, Customer Success, Innovation, and Equality. By making technology more accessible, we're helping create a future with greater opportunity and equality for all. This has taken our company to great heights, including being ranked by Fortune as one of the Most Admired Companies in the World and one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For eleven years in a row, and named Innovator of the Decade and one of the World's Most Innovative Companies eight years in a row by Forbes. There are those who choose to work with the best and brightest. And then, there are those who want to do more than just a job. They are the ones improving lives, not only their careers. Having an impact now instead of later. Doing something that's so much bigger than themselves, an industry, and their company. We believe everyone can be a Trailblazer. Join Salesforce and discover a future of new opportunities.

Job Information Lumen Intern - Data Engineer - Summer 2022, CO or Remote/WFH (US) in St. Paul, Minnesota About Lumen Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumens network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies. The Role Lumens US Internship Program is a path for career readiness in the 4th Industrial Revolution. Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology. During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time. Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. The Experience * Innovate to deliver solutions to real business problems * Transform your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects * Connect to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. * Impact through Community & Social Involvement collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves. The Main Responsibilities As a Data Engineer in our Strategic Planning and Transformation organization. This role will have the opportunity to support the process, making it possible for consumers of data, such as analysts, data scientists, and executives to inspect all data available reliably, quickly, and securely. The intern should have an interest in application development with a mindset to take initiative, be resourceful and curious, not afraid to ask question and make suggestions with new ideas. * Work with modern and leading-edge technologies to assist with Lumens growth and transformation initiatives. * Build data pipelines for use by business partners and stakeholders to drive outcomes. * Assist in the collection of web traffic data, product provisioning time and tracking of data footprint. What We Look For in a Candidate * Education Requirements * Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, rising senior or masters level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 June 2023. * Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or similar technical degree. * Proficiency and understanding of * Familiar with ETL tools * Familiar with Python, SQL, MongoDB, Kafka * Familiar with Microsoft Azure and Synapse or Spark * Professional Attributes * Strong drive for results and taking initiative * Resourceful and adaptable * Collaborative and have agility while making effective decisions * Strong written and verbal communication skills * Ability to interact with business partners and drive the conversation. * Flexible and adapts well to change * Work Setting * The position will be in one of the following offices: Broomfield or Littleton, CO or work from home/remote. * Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June 3 August 12, 2022) * Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations) * US work authorization required What to Expect Next After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position. A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application. For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application. Thank you! About GMThere's never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors.To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won't happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.Why Work for UsOur culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including open work spaces and virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteer interests, and make it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities.Job Description2022 Spring/Summer InternshipThis is a remote position, the selected candidate can reside and perform the work from anywhere within the United States.#LI-Remote #GeneralMotorsAt GM, we earn customers for life. We have a culture of building brands that inspire passion and loyalty. Therefore we've created a new group. This is an exciting area that is functioning as a startup but with the stability of a 100+ year old company.About Customer Experience: Global Customer Experience (CX) organization to focus on delivering world-class experiences to our customers. The mission of CX organization is to design and build digital products, services, and experiences for General Motors customers globally. The group will accomplish this mission by bringing together customer, brand, and competitor insights from across the enterprise and using them to design, prioritize, and build the best enterprise-wide solutions.There are variety of areas within CX and your summer internship can be based on your interest, qualifications and best fit for the business.* CX Chief Engineering Assistant Program Analyst - where you will be working with more technical teams in Engineering and IT to work cohesively in achieving an enterprise-wide customer experience vision. You will help construct, plan, and lead technical programs for products, services, and customer experience software.* System Operations Intern - where your primary responsibility is to provide analytical support to the System Vehicle team which often means pursuing independent projects and working closely with others. Here you will have responsibilities in robust quantitative analysis by manipulating data using Microsoft Excel, Oracle Database, Minitab and Hadoop data analytics.Additional Job DescriptionQualifications:* Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in one of the following areas: Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science, Software, or Technical Architecture* Able to work full-time, 40 hours per week* Must be Sophomore standing or higher* Ability to work in ambiguous situations* Shown capability to collaborate with different people and groups to gain trust and hit program objectives* Demonstrated learning agilityDesired Skills:* Outstanding interpersonal and relationship management skills to effectively collaborate with varying levels of the organization as needed* Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to distill complex subjects to a wider audience* Emerging partnership and collaboration skills and ability to learn from and share knowledge with co-workers in a fast-paced environment* High level of integrity, ability to dealApply here: https://www.aplitrak.com/?adid=YmJnZW5lcmljLjA5MTA1LjEwNTA4QGdtY29tcGFueWNvbXAuYXBsaXRyYWsuY29t

Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies. THE ROLE Lumen’s Internship Program is a path for career readiness in the 4th Industrial Revolution.  Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology.  During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time.  Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. The Experience  -    Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems  -    Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects -    Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. -    Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.   THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES As a Software Developer in our Strategic Planning and Transformation organization, the Intern will be a part of IT Asset Management team.  This is a technical team that manages our hardware asset management CMDB and our software asset management discovery tool.  During the 10 weeks you will be a part of server and database data analysis, validation, and mitigation.  Website content management and process documentation review.  The ideal intern will need a high level of engagement and ability to take initiative, ask questions and work in a team environment.  •    Data analysis and troubleshooting  •    Familiarity with GUI based tools  •    Experience with Excel including pivot tables  •    Familiarity with basic IT infrastructure (servers, databases, storage, networking devices)  •    Scripting experience WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE - Education Requirements  -    Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, be a rising junior, a rising senior or master’s level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – May 2023. -    Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or similar technical degree field. -    Proficiency and understanding of;  -    IT Infrastructure -    Scripting -    Excel -    GUI based tools - Professional Attributes  -    Strong drive for results and taking initiative -    Ability to be resourceful and adaptable -    Willingness to ask questions and take initiative -    Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions -    Strong written and verbal communication skills -    Ability to interact with business partners and drive the conversation. -    Flexible and adapts well to change - Work Setting -    Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Broomfield -CO, Littleton-CO or Remote  -    Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June – August) -    Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations) -    US work authorization  WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you! THE ROLE LUMEN’S INTERNSHIP PROGRAM IS A PATH FOR CAREER READINESS IN THE 4TH INDUSTRIAL REVOLUTION.   Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology.  During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time.  Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace.   THE EXPERIENCE - INNOVATE – to deliver solutions to real business problems - TRANSFORM – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects - CONNECT – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. - IMPACT – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.   Join Lumen's UX Team as we re-imagine and reinvent how large Telecoms can better interact with and support their customers in a way that is more modern, digital-first, intuitive, and friendly. Design user experiences used by millions of people everyday, take on complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs. Collaborate with teams of Designers, Researchers, Engineers and Product Managers throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes. At each stage, you will anticipate what our users need, advocate for them and ensure that the final product surprises and delights them. Bring your experience in Design Thinking and your pragmatic user-centered and data-informed design approach to create innovative, usable, great-looking products that people love to use.   We're looking for a UX Research Intern to help us make the performance of complex tasks an intuitive, elegant, and satisfying user experience. As part of a growing UX team you'll collaborate with multiple teams to create software for our customers that is powerful, feature-rich, yet easy to use. We value creative, self-driven individuals who care about the work they produce and the people they work with and we love a good sense of humor, too. The User Experience Research Intern will work with product design teams to identify research needs and deliver user-centered findings that help design useful, usable, and desirable user experiences.   JOB DESCRIPTION The ideal candidate for this role is a problem-solver and self-starter who effectively collaborates with other teams to deliver user-centric insights. The selected intern will help define and shape solutions that scale, using multiple research tools and techniques to uncover user insights. Your fellow researchers will provide you with support and mentorship.   RESPONSIBILITIES: - Conduct qualitative and quantitative research to help inform requirements and validate design decisions - Advocate for the user and champion the value of research as part of the decision-making process - Collaborate with our product managers, engineers, UX designers, and UX researchers to improve engagement and reduce friction across multiple digital products - Participate in multidisciplinary brainstorms, working sessions, and other collaborative discussions   WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS: - Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Communications, Psychology, Computer Science, or have other related experience. - Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university; junior or senior level education status at the start of the internship (graduating August 2022 – June 2023). PREFERRED EXPERIENCE: - Familiarity with Quantitative and Qualitative Research Methods - Have a passion for understanding and building empathy for humans - A portfolio and/or case studies demonstrating student work. - Experienced in data-gathering and analysis techniques across qualitative and quantitative methods - Able to multitask and work in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment - Excited to solve unique and challenging problems - Thrive on collaboration, working side by side with people of all backgrounds and disciplines, and have strong verbal and written communications PROFESSIONAL ATTRIBUTES: - Strong drive for results and taking initiative - Ability to be resourceful and adaptable - Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions   WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you! * Build a Resume * Find a job salary * Jobs * Login * Search All Jobs Customer Experience- Technical Intern at General Motors in Honolulu, Hawaii Posted in Other about 15 hours ago. ------------ Job Description: About GM There's never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors. To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won't happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future. Why Work for Us Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including open work spaces and virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteer interests, and make it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities. Job Description 2022 Spring/Summer Internship This is a remote position, the selected candidate can reside and perform the work from anywhere within the United States. #LI-Remote #GeneralMotors At GM, we earn customers for life. We have a culture of building brands that inspire passion and loyalty. Therefore we've created a new group. This is an exciting area that is functioning as a startup but with the stability of a 100+ year old company. About Customer Experience: Global Customer Experience (CX) organization to focus on delivering world-class experiences to our customers. The mission of CX organization is to design and build digital products, services, and experiences for General Motors customers globally. The group will accomplish this mission by bringing together customer, brand, and competitor insights from across the enterprise and using them to design, prioritize, and build the best enterprise-wide solutions. There are variety of areas within CX and your summer internship can be based on your interest, qualifications and best fit for the business. * CX Chief Engineering Assistant Program Analyst - where you will be working with more technical teams in Engineering and IT to work cohesively in achieving an enterprise-wide customer experience vision. You will help construct, plan, and lead technical programs for products, services, and customer experience software. * System Operations Intern - where your primary responsibility is to provide analytical support to the System Vehicle team which often means pursuing independent projects and working closely with others. Here you will have responsibilities in robust quantitative analysis by manipulating data using Microsoft Excel, Oracle Database, Minitab and Hadoop data analytics. Additional Job Description Qualifications: * Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in one of the following areas: Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science, Software, or Technical Architecture * Able to work full-time, 40 hours per week * Must be Sophomore standing or higher * Ability to work in ambiguous situations * Shown capability to collaborate with different people and groups to gain trust and hit program objectives * Demonstrated learning agility Desired Skills: * Outstanding interpersonal and relationship management skills to effectively collaborate with varying levels of the organization as needed * Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to distill complex subjects to a wider audience * Emerging partnership and collaboration skills and ability to learn from and share knowledge with co-workers in a fast-paced environment * High level of integrity, ability to deal with ambiguity, take initiative/self-directed * Evidence of strong character with honesty, accountability and trust * Consistently demonstrates innovative thinking that is customer-centric This is a remote position, the selected candidate can reside and perform the work from anywhere within the United States. #LI-Remote #GeneralMotors The median level of the monthly salary compensation for this role is $4300 dependent upon class status and degree. Benefit options are not available for this role. PLEASE ONLY APPLY IF YOU DO NOT NEED SPONSORSHIP TO WORK IN THE UNITED STATES NOW OR IN THE FUTURE. WE ARE UNABLE TO CONSIDER CANDIDATES WHO REQUIRE SPONSORSHIP. GM will provide a one-time lump sum taxable stipend payment to each student selected for the 2022 Student Program Diversity Information General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging.
