Information Security Intern TopekaYou may know Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Kansas as the largest health insurer in the state, but behind those well-known symbols stand nearly 1,600 people dedicated to our customers. We are looking for energetic individuals who are seeking a career with one of the most trusted names in Kansas. Interns have the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment utilizing technologies, languages, and services to support the rapidly changing healthcare industry. Interns will broaden their knowledge by being exposed to various programming languages and tools, architectures, security, and supporting database systems. You will receive diversified learning opportunities through on-the-job assignments, utilizing the technical skills that you have acquired in college. This internship will assist you in developing technically and professionally. Are you ready to make a difference? Choose to work for one of the most trusted companies in Kansas. Essential Functions The Information Technology Intern will assist with IT projects, initiatives and assist with support. Projects may include: * Hardware and software troubleshooting; * Interaction with end-users * Analyze problems, gather requirements, and determine and implement a solution. * Apply skills in the areas of: requirements definition, vulnerability discovery, security hardening of existing products, and defensive control capability implementations. * Responsible for researching and recommending security products that could be used in the environment to increase security posture and enhance security usability. * Giving a presentation about your work assignment and projects, as well as what you learned from the internship program * Attend a volunteer activity with other interns within the company. Qualifications Skills Preferred * Creativity, Innovation * Critical, Logical, and Results-driven thinking * Experience in any of the following: Cyber Defense competitions, Ethical hacking, Firewall administration, Identity and Access administration, Authentication and Authorization, Cloud Engineering, Endpoint Security administration, Security operations and design * Proven leadership experience * Strong oral and written communication skills * Knowledge and working experience with MS Word, Excel and general IT infrastructure components; including but not limited to servers, desktops, and/or databases. Requirements Preferred * Current enrollment in a bachelor#39;s degree program with junior or senior status * At least 6 earned college credit hours related to computer science and/or Cybersecurity * Cumulative GPA of 3.0 above * Must successfully complete relevant aptitude assessment(s) for the competencies needed for the position where applicable * Authorization to work in the U.S. without company sponsorship * Strong written, verbal, analytical and interpersonal skills required. Must display maturity and a high level of professionalism * Demonstrates acceptance of responsibility; shows pride in work performed; demonstrates flexibility in acceptance of assignments and schedules; maintains professional behavior and appearance; exhibits dependability Compensation $23.25 per hour Posting Close Date September 26, 2021 Pay Rate Type HourlyPosted TodayFull timeR2021391 For more than 70 years, Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Kansas has built a reputation of trust. As we move forward in this new era of health care we want to continue that tradition. Whether a member needs Blue Cross to cover an annual check-up or give them peace of mind during a major medical crisis, we want our members to know they can trust BCBSKS to meet their needs.nbsp; Our mission: Being the insurer Kansans trust with their health. ***Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled*** ***Blue Cross Blue Shield of Kansas invites any applicant and/or employee to review the Companys written Affirmative Action Plan. nbsp;This plan is available for inspection upon request by contacting the EEO Office at (785)291-8639.*** nbsp;

Job Information Labcorp Internship: Pharmacometrics in Honolulu, Hawaii Job Overview: Company Overview: At Labcorp, we believe in the power of science to change lives. We are a leading global life sciences company that delivers answers for crucial health questions because we know that knowledge has the potential to make life better for all. Through our unparalleled diagnostics and drug development capabilities, we provide insights and accelerate innovations that not only empower patients and providers but help medical, biotech, and pharmaceutical companies transform ideas into innovations. Here, you can join our more than 70,000 employees, serving clients in more than 100 countries, as we work together to make a real impact on peoples lives. Join us in our pursuit of answers. Advancing healthcare from the laboratory through the clinic requires many different strengths, experiences and perspectives of our exceptional people around the world. Explore our wide range of diverse opportunities and rewarding career pathways and see how you can work with an energizing purpose to discover your extraordinary potential. Global Internship Program: Exciting opportunity to be part of the Labcorp 2022 Global Internship Program as a Pharmacometrics Intern ! As a Labcorp intern, you will have the opportunity to support meaningful assignments that compliment an education in STEM+ Business and Healthcare disciplines, and are inspiring and valuable in our mission to improve health and improve lives across the globe. In addition to department work, we support your professional development and career exploration through program workshops, leadership speakers, employee resource group introductions, new hire panel discussions and small group coffee chats. Capitalize on a dedicated training and development program that will support your scientific and professional career aspirations, and take pride in delivering work that helps save the lives of millions of people around the world. About the Team : * The Global Pharmacometrics team provides a range of modeling & simulation services for clients including both nonclinical and clinical. Examples (not all-inclusive) include: PK/PD, PBPK, DDI, popPK, etc. Internship Assignment Summary: * Investigate implementation of PBPK modeling for incorporation into PKPD models for large molecule (antibodies, proteins, oligonucleotides, etc.) * Generate PBPK and drug-drug interaction (DDI) models using GastroPlus� (or other suitable) software * Attend training sessions to learn modeling software and tools * Engage in professional development workshops to enhance your business acumen and professional presence Education/Qualifications: * Working towards master's, or PhD degree in Pharmaceutical Sciences, Toxicology, Pharmcokinetics, Pharmacometrics, or related field; other scientific disciplines may be considered; practical understanding of Drug Metabolism desired Experience: * Has experience delivering multiple projects in an academic or professional setting * Ability to collaborate with various stakeholders and internal/external colleagues * Embraces diverse ways of thinking through various forms collaboration and partnership

Pendo is looking for dynamic, motivated, and self-driven team members to join our Data Analytics team this summer as a Data Analytics Intern! Data is vitally important for understanding the success of the business. You will be responsible for querying and analyzing data, as well as building visualizations that help the organization quickly understand how the overall business and each functional group is performing. We are looking for tech savvy students interested in working in a fast-paced, rapidly growing tech environment.. In addition to the day to day responsibilities this intern will hold, you will also be provided mentorship and development via one on one time with our entire Data Analytics team. Responsibilities (what you'll do): Work closely with the business analytics team and representatives from all functional groups to understand their workflows, data, and business challenges. Use data analysis tools to explore, segment and understand data in order to find useful insights. Build dashboards that help teams understand overall performance and focus areas. Communicate business insights using dashboards to key stakeholders. Learn how a fast-paced and growing business measures success and makes decisions. Qualifications (what you have): Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Analytics, Business, or other technical discipline. Excellent communication, storytelling, and presentation skills. Technical curiosity, an eye for user experience, and a desire to enable faster innovation. Working knowledge of SQL. Nice to have - experience with Business Intelligence tools (ex. Looker). Pendo Description: Pendo was founded in 2013 by former product managers, who combined their heads and hearts to build something they wanted but never had as product managers -- a simple way to understand and attack what truly drives product success. Our mission is to improve society's experience with software. Come join one of the fastest-growing startups, supported by best-in-class institutions like Battery Ventures, Salesforce Ventures, Spark Capital and Meritech. You will gain experience in a diverse and exciting set of technologies and clients and have a real impact on Pendo's future. Our culture is passionate, dynamic, and fun. EEOC We are an equal opportunity employer and believe having diverse teams where everyone brings their whole self to Pendo is key to our success. We welcome all people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. Accessibility Pendo is committed to working with, and providing access and reasonable accommodation to, applicants with mental and/or physical disabilities. If you think you may require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process, please send a request to: accommodation@pendo.io. All requests for accommodations are treated discreetly and confidentially, as practical and permitted by law.

Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace.   THE EXPERIENCE - INNOVATE – to deliver solutions to real business problems - TRANSFORM – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects - CONNECT – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. - IMPACT – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.   Join CenturyLink’s UX Team as we re-imagine and reinvent how large Telecoms can better interact with and support their customers in a way that is more modern, digital-first, intuitive, and friendly. Design user experiences used by millions of people everyday, take on complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs. Collaborate with teams of Designers, Researchers, Engineers and Product Managers throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes. At each stage, you will anticipate what our users need, advocate for them and ensure that the final product surprises and delights them. Bring your experience in Design Thinking and your pragmatic user-centered and data-informed design approach to create innovative, usable, great-looking products that people love to use. OVERVIEW   We're looking for a UX Design Intern to help us make the performance of complex tasks an intuitive, elegant, and satisfying user experience. As part of a growing UX team you'll collaborate with multiple teams to create software for our customers that is powerful, feature-rich, yet easy to use. The ideal candidate is a problem-solver and self-starter who effectively collaborates with other teams to deliver user-centric design. You will create solutions that scale, using multiple tools and techniques to communicate your ideas. Your fellow designers and our user researcher will provide you with support and mentorship.   RESPONSIBILITIES:   - Creating design solutions, with deliverables such as user flows, wireframes, clickable prototypes, high-fidelity mockups and detailed design specifications - Presenting design work to fellow designers, as well as product and engineering teams, and business stakeholders - Contributing to guidelines and design standardization across a product portfolio - Incorporating customer feedback and usability findings into a design - Partnering with product and design to plan and prioritize work, resolve issues, and remove roadblocks - Planning new features, projects, and products; understanding business objectives, analyzing customer behaviors, identifying UX problems and/or unmet customer needs.     WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE   - Pursing a Bachelor's degree or higher in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science information technology, or related discipline. - Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, rising senior or master’s level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – June 2023. - Proven experience in user-centered design with hands-on experience throughout the process, from user research to developing prototypes and collaborating on implementation. - Experience in delivering wireframes, UX flows, mockups, interactive prototypes, personas, and use case development is required. - Ability and passion to understand distinct user groups quickly and distill complex needs into clean, understandable solutions. - Understanding of information architecture, design patterns, and interaction design. - Work as a member of our cross-functional team, partnering with users, product owners, business analysts, and development teams to deliver business value. - Ability to work independently, managing schedules in a dynamic, multi-project environment Familiarity and ability to promote appropriate usability testing and user research endeavors. - Experience with design and prototyping software (e.g., any of the following: Sketch, InVision, Figma, Adobe Creative Suite) - Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills - you will be expected to be able to defend design decisions in an articulate, inclusive manner, and be able to incorporate constructive criticism - Defining, managing, and prioritizing your own work, juggling multiple projects - Passion for the role of design in shaping digital experiences - Using design systems, pattern libraries, and user research to help inform design decisions WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT   After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you! Join CenturyLink’s UX Team as we re-imagine and reinvent how large Telecoms can better interact with and support their customers in a way that is more modern, digital-first, intuitive, and friendly. Design user experiences used by millions of people everyday, take on complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs. Collaborate with teams of Designers, Researchers, Engineers and Product Managers throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes. At each stage, you will anticipate what our users need, advocate for them and ensure that the final product surprises and delights them. Bring your experience in Design Thinking and your pragmatic user-centered and data-informed design approach to create innovative, usable, great-looking products that people love to use. OVERVIEW   We're looking for a UX Design Intern to help us make the performance of complex tasks an intuitive, elegant, and satisfying user experience. As part of a growing UX team you'll collaborate with multiple teams to create software for our customers that is powerful, feature-rich, yet easy to use. The ideal candidate is a problem-solver and self-starter who effectively collaborates with other teams to deliver user-centric design. You will create solutions that scale, using multiple tools and techniques to communicate your ideas. Your fellow designers and our user researcher will provide you with support and mentorship. position: Audit & Assurance Staff Intern Japanese Services Group
description: Job Information Deloitte Audit & Assurance Staff Intern (Japanese Services Group) - Summer 2022, Winter 2023 in Honolulu, Hawaii The internship program provides an introduction to audit. As an intern in Deloitte's Audit practice, you'll experience the auditing profession from a real-world perspective. You'll get in-depth exposure to the auditing profession and learn more about the day-to-day responsibilities of an auditor. You'll receive guidance and work closely with experienced audit professionals, as well as have the opportunity to participate in networking activities. You'll have exposure to issues shaping and affecting the profession today as well as topics related to your own career development. Your counselor will serve as a vital source of information and advice, offering timely, constructive feedback on your performance. Work you'll do During your internship, you'll sharpen your analytical skills as you audit client financials, transactions and internal control processes. You'll work with audit team members and learn how to apply concepts of risk assessment and how to design and perform audit procedures responsive to those risks. You will execute these audit procedures using our cutting-edge audit tools and technologies that use artificial intelligence, advanced analytics, data visualizations and process flow automation to perform data interrogation and analysis of client data. The team Our team culture is collaborative and encourages team members to take initiative and seek on-the-job learning opportunities. Our audit professionals are committed to excellence and to enhancing the trust of the investing public and capital markets. Quality is our top priority, and by focusing on innovation, we continue to raise the bar on quality and deliver greater value to our clients. Learn more about Deloitte Audit. Qualifications Required: * Pursuing a Bachelor of Science/Business Administration of Science degree in Accounting or related field * Definitive plans for meeting minimum requirements for CPA eligibility * Strong academic track record, minimum GPA of 3.0 * Travel up to 80% (While 80% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.) * Must be fluent in Japanese * Limited immigration sponsorship may be available Preferred: * Master of Science in Accounting or related field * Demonstrated effective verbal and written communication skills * Proven leadership skills demonstrating strong judgment, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities * Proven experience working independently and managing multiple assignments in a dynamic environment All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Job Information Labcorp Financial Planning and Analysis Intern in Honolulu, Hawaii Job Overview: Who is Labcorp? At Labcorp, we believe in the power of science to change lives. We are a leading global life sciences company that delivers answers for crucial health questions because we know that knowledge has the potential to make life better for all. Through our unparalleled diagnostics and drug development capabilities, we provide insights and accelerate innovations that not only empower patients and providers but help medical, biotech, and pharmaceutical companies transform ideas into innovations. Here, you can join our more than 70,000 employees, serving clients in more than 100 countries, as we work together to make a real impact on peoples lives. Join us in our pursuit of answers. Advancing healthcare from the laboratory through the clinic requires many different strengths, experiences and perspectives of our exceptional people around the world. Explore our wide range of diverse opportunities and rewarding career pathways and see how you can work with an energizing purpose to discover your extraordinary potential. Global Internship Program: Exciting opportunity to be part of the Labcorp 2022 Global Internship Program as a Finance Intern ! As a Labcorp intern, you will have the opportunity to support meaningful assignments that compliment an education in STEM+ Business and Healthcare disciplines, and are inspiring and valuable in our mission to improve health and improve lives across the globe. In addition to department work, we support your professional development and career exploration through program workshops, leadership speakers, employee resource group introductions, new hire panel discussions and small group coffee chats. Capitalize on a dedicated training and development program that will support your scientific and professional career aspirations, and take pride in delivering work that helps save the lives of millions of people around the world. The Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) department acts as a key business partner to organizational leaders to execute company business plan and meet financial commitments. Primary responsibilities of the internship include: * Enhance and further develop key business and financial metrics used to inform and guide the business * Collaborate with team and business leaders to begin budgetary planning process for the upcoming fiscal year * Familiarize yourself with business development platforms to analyze and visualize data into valuable insights for more informed decision making * Provides the opportunity to present key findings and insights to finance and business management Education/Qualifications: * Working towards bachelors degree in Finance or other Business administration related field Experience: * Has experience balancing multiple deliverables in an academic or professional setting * Ability to collaborate with various stakeholders and internal/external colleagues * Embraces diverse ways of thinking through various forms collaboration and partnership * Microsoft Suite experience preferred

Job Overview: Company Overview: At Labcorp, we believe in the power of science to change lives. We are a leading global life sciences company that delivers answers for crucial health questions because we know that knowledge has the potential to make life better for all. Through our unparalleled diagnostics and drug development capabilities, we provide insights and accelerate innovations that not only empower patients and providers but help medical, biotech, and pharmaceutical companies transform ideas into innovations. Here, you can join our more than 70,000 employees, serving clients in more than 100 countries, as we work together to make a real impact on people's lives. Join us in our pursuit of answers. Advancing healthcare from the laboratory through the clinic requires many different strengths, experiences and perspectives of our exceptional people around the world. Explore our wide range of diverse opportunities and rewarding career pathways and see how you can work with an energizing purpose to discover your extraordinary potential. Global Internship Program: Exciting opportunity to be part of the Labcorp 2022 Global Internship Program as a Talent Acquisition Training & Process Intern ! As a Labcorp intern, you will have the opportunity to support meaningful assignments that compliment an education in STEM+ Business and Healthcare disciplines, and are inspiring and valuable in our mission to improve health and improve lives across the globe. In addition to department work, we support your professional development and career exploration through program workshops, leadership speakers, employee resource group introductions, new hire panel discussions and small group coffee chats'. Capitalize on a dedicated training and development program that will support your scientific and professional career aspirations, and take pride in delivering work that helps save the lives of millions of people around the world. About the Team : As part of the Global Talent Acquisition (GTA) team, Training & Process prepares and integrates new recruiters and recruiting coordinators to use our systems, tools and policies to attract, engage and hire new talent The Talent Acquisition Intern is focused around supporting our Talent Acquisition teams across scientific and clinical functions and this intern will support a variety of broad based projects for the function. This position is currently remote due to COVID-19. Working towards bachelor's degree in Human Resources Has experience delivering multiple projects in an academic or professional setting Ability to collaborate with various stakeholders and internal/external colleagues Embraces diverse ways of thinking through various forms collaboration and partnership Partner with HR teams and Leaders to drive efficient onboarding, hiring and associated processes'. Have an interest in learning about HR data and analytics. Education/Qualifications: Working towards bachelor's degree in Human Resources Ability to collaborate with various stakeholders and internal/external colleagues Embraces diverse ways of thinking through various forms collaboration and partnership Partner with HR teams and Leaders to drive efficient onboarding, hiring and associated processes'. Have an interest in learning about HR data and analytics. Experience: Has experience delivering multiple projects in an academic or professional setting

Job Information Lumen Intern - Business Analyst - Summer 2022- CO or NATIONWIDE in St. Paul, Minnesota About Lumen Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumens network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies. The Role Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology. During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time. Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. The Experience Innovate to deliver solutions to real business problems Transform your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects Connect to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. Impact through Community & Social Involvement collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves. The Main Responsibilities As a Project Management Intern in our North America Field Operations & Network Implementation organization, you will work collaboratively with our team to assist customers in activating and testing products and technologies. Tasks during the 10 weeks will have impact on the customers as well as the business. Project Manager interns will have the potential to learn about fiber products, project management, data research, and many other Lumen programs. This will give interns the opportunity to have a customer facing role while also improving the company through research, management, and technical training. Onsite manager will be available for on the job training and coaching of the intern. Assist with our Revenue Acceleration Program This role will provide experience in project management, collaboration, and general business meeting practices. Communicate and coordinate actions across the team based on the data identified. Engage in the active Automation/Transformation projects and provide PM support Provide PM support for select Top 10 projects underway within our organization Engage in Employee Engagement activities Participate in the DIB (Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging) program Engage in the Training program. Complete entry level virtual lab modules and provide feedback Provide Teams and Sharepoint support Engage in Data Analytics Ride along with the various teams to better understand the team structure and responsibilities Complete a presentation at the end of the internship to summarize the experience and provide feedback What We Look For in a Candidate * Pursuing a Bachelors degree in business or tech related field Telecommunications, Business management, Data Analytics, Computer Science, or similar degree program. * Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university; Junior or Senior education status at the start of the internship (graduating August 2022 May 2024). * GPA: 3.0 or higher preferred, not required * If position is in office, must have transportation to/from work daily * Must be available to work 30 40 hours, during the specified 10-week timeframe. * Experience with Microsoft suit is required * General techology knowledge is appreciated * Candidates are expected to exhibit critical thinking skills and time management/prioritization skills. * Work well in collaborative group settings. * Detail oriented. * Able to learn and adapt quickly. * Strong sense of urgency and ability to meet deadlines * Ability to demonstrate ownership and accountability * Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions * Strong written and verbal communication skills What to Expect Next After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position. A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application. For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application. Thank you! position: Marketing & Social Media Internship at EdTech Startup
description:
Do you love creative writing? Do you have an eye for design? Are you fond of math and science? If you answered yes to all three (or at least the first two), we'd love to hear from you.

We're looking for an intern to join us this fall to help us with marketing, social media and copywriting. While this is an internship, you will be in the driver's seat, leading our social media efforts and engaging directly with our growing community of educators and students. This is a great opportunity to demonstrate your skills and make a real difference at a small startup.

An ideal candidate is someone who is proactive, organized and self-directed. Equally important are creative instincts and a good sense of humor. If this sounds like you, send us your resumé and a brief note about why you're a good fit for the role.

description: Job Information Lumen Intern - Cyber Security Technical Writer Intern - Summer 2022 - Nationwide/Remote in St. Paul, Minnesota About Lumen Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. The Main Responsibilities As a Cyber Security Cybersecurity Technical Writer Intern in our North America Operations organization, you will work collaboratively with the Security Awareness and Security Policy team to educate Lumen personnel in cybersecurity best practices as well as ongoing management of the Lumen Information Security Policy and related technical standards and methods and procedures. Tasks during the 10 weeks will have a direct impact on security and training within Lumen. Cyber Security Cybersecurity Technical Writer Interns will have opportunities to explore the cybersecurity field without extensive technical background. * Conduct a review of all documents in the Lumen security policy set to identify opportunities to modernize both the language and requirements. * Work with the Senior Lead Information Security Engineer to conduct a thorough review of the revised ISO 27002 standard (expected publication by 2Q2022) to determine changes needed in the Information Security Policy. * Work with the Senior Security Engineer to conduct phishing training. * Work with the Security Awareness team to create new articles for publication. * Work with the Security Awareness team to develop plans for Cybersecurity Awareness Month 2022. * Research new material for the Security Ambassador Program content library. * Work with the Manager to develop new training content. What We Look For in a Candidate Education Requirements o Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, rising senior or masters level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 May 2023. o Major/Degree: Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Communications, PR/Marketing, or English or a related field Proficiency and understanding of: o Microsoft Suites o Knowledge of security awareness tools is a plus o Video Editing experience is a plus Professional Attributes o Strong drive for results and taking initiative o Intrinsically motivated to meet deadlines and achieve goals o Ability to translate technical concepts into easy-to-understand language o Ability to think creatively and consider multiple perspectives o Ability to demonstrate ownership and accountability o Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions o Strong written and verbal communication skills Work Setting o Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Remote- Work From Home o Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June August) o Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location if not remote (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations) What to Expect Next After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position. A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application. For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application. Thank you! Senior InternSenior Intern positions provide the necessary training to potentially develop into a Senior Staff position. Typically, individuals can progress from a Senior Intern to a Senior Staff as they develop and gain experience through required training. Senior Interns are responsible for assessing the clients current level of development across the various sections of the curriculum, designing the majority of the client programs, writing the Individual Treatment Plan (under the direction of the Clinical Supervisor and Lead Therapist), and providing most of the hands-on supervision for Behavior Technicians. Senior Intern responsibilities and caseloads systematically increase as training goals are met. Essential Functions: 1. Completes required office and field training toward a Senior Staff position and demonstrates mastery with training goals. 2. Develops client-specific therapeutic treatment plans based on appropriate assessments and developmental guidelines. 3. In conjunction with supervisory staff and caregivers, develops programs appropriate to the current and future needs of the clients. Creates programs, moves targets forward, prepares program materials, and makes procedural changes as needed. 4. Designs and implements behavior observation systems, support plans, and intervention guidelines. 5. Coordinates the collection, summarization and analysis of data related to individual program goals and behavioral plans. 6. Consults with Behavior Technicians, caregivers, and supervisory staff to ensure that programming is adequate to meet the needs of the client. 7. Analyzes program data to ensure appropriate progress and effectiveness. 8. Develops and maintains weekly and monthly progress notes, reviews clinical documentation of Behavior Technicians, and updates treatment plans. 9. Completes appropriate assessments and probes new targets to determine future goals. 10. Communicates with parents, guardians or other caregivers concerning behavioral and educational programming. 11. Supervises, orients, and trains Behavior Technicians in the implementation of programs and behavioral intervention procedures, routinely providing ongoing coaching and feedback to enhance staff development and skill. Ensures Behavior Technician is oriented appropriately to the company and follows all policies and procedures. 12. Evaluates Behavior Technician performance and addresses issues to ensure quality and consistency across clinical programs. 13. Proactively addresses employee relation issues or concerns, including ongoing coaching and feedback, employee development, performance management, and if appropriate, disciplinary action. 14. May participate in weekly clinical team meetings to discuss case progress, address Behavior Technician and caregiver concerns, review individual program plans, and recommend revisions as necessary. 15. Provides verbal, written, and graphic communications. 16. Consults with supervisory staff to ensure the provision of effective and efficient service delivery. 17. Continually develops skills and knowledge in the area of behavior analysis through participation in continuing education, workshops, and required company trainings. 18. Follows and abides by all APA ethical guidelines and appropriate policies, regulations, and laws including confidentiality and HIPAA. Adheres to mandated reporting regulations. Supervisory Responsibility: Supervises Behavior Technician on assigned client cases. Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be exposed to a client who exhibits physically aggressive behavior which can include kicking, pinching, punching, biting, etc. The employee may have to use appropriate behavior management techniques frequently with a client under such circumstances. Such response requires agility, quick reflexes, and the ability to use physically evasive movement. The employee will be constantly required to stand, walk, sit, grasp, reach, bend, kneel, crouch, squat, hear, type and write. In addition, the employee will be exposed to normal office conditions and usual office equipment such as phone, computer, printers, copiers, files, etc. The employee must be able to independently and repeatedly lift, move and carry objects weighing up to thirty-five (35) pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include near, far, and field of vision. Speech must be spoken in a way in which others will understand. This position requires regular and punctual employee presence. Qualifications: Education: A Bachelors Degree in a human services discipline or documentation of actively pursuing a Bachelors Degree in a human services discipline with anticipated graduation date within six months from initiation of internship and at least 1,500 hours of training or supervised experience in the use of behaviorally based therapy models consistent with best practice and research on the effectiveness for children with autism spectrum disorders who meet all criteria to receive this service, OR A Bachelors Degree in a non-human services discipline and actively pursuing either a BCaBA, BCBA, or a Masters Degree in a human services discipline with graduation/certification date within six months from initiation of internship, and at least 1,500 hours of training or supervised experience in the use of behaviorally based therapy models consistent with best practice and research on effectiveness for children with autism spectrum disorders who meet all criteria to receive this service, OR A Board Certified Assistant Behavior Analyst (BCaBA) with a minimum of 400 hours of hands-on training in providing ABA services directly to children and/or adults with autism under the supervision of a Board-Certified Behavior Analyst who has at least two years of experience in ABA programming for individuals with autism, OR Legal authorization to perform psychotherapy, with a Masters Degree in one of the behavioral sciences who has at least 400 hours of training or supervised experience in the use of behaviorally-based therapy models consistent with best practice and research on effectiveness for children with autism spectrum disorders, in addition to, or as part of their 3,000 hours of training/supervision; and have sufficient written evidence of training and/or education in the method of evidence-based therapy being delivered, prior to the provision of services. Experience: Must have at least 1,500 hours experience working as a Behavior Technician implementing programs based on ABA principles. Must have experience working with children and adolescents, utilizing ABA therapies. A solid understanding of autism and behavioral principles. Experience utilizing applied behavior analytic strategies to modify behavior. Experience with functional behavior assessments and writing behavior support plans. Other: Must be 18 years old or older. Must have a valid drivers license and provide proof of auto insurance.

Total MD puts lifestyle science into action through accredited health coaching that delivers blockbuster patient outcomes:

Backed by randomized, controlled clinical trials. Proven to activate and sustain long-term patient outcomes. We see even BETTER outcomes at one year.

Personalized to each patient. Patients are matched with a dedicated coach and receive a program tailored to all their health needs... NOT just one condition.

Often prescribed by physicians and covered by most insurance.

Delivered via mobile telehealth.

With a strong focus on and team dedicated to clinical research, we aim to gain a high level of credibility within the emerging markets of health coaching and telehealth. We have conducted two, first of their kind, NIH-funded, independent clinical trials focused on telehealth-based health coaching, applicable to physician practices, health systems, and complementary service trials.

Total MD- Research Data Internship

Objectives:

1) Understand research and data collection methods in the health coaching and virtual services industry

2) Apply data analysis skills to different coaching delivery models (provider and employer wellness). 3) Understand research and conference presentation writing and oral skills

Job Description and Duties:

Work virtually, while still going to school and completing an internship helping others better their health through lifestyle support.

We provide off-site 100% remote lifestyle support to participants throughout the country. As a Lifestyle Health Coach, you will have the opportunity to help improve the quality of life for participants through lifestyle modification (nutrition, fitness, behavior change, and support).

You will have the opportunity learn data collection technique that support health coaching in various areas.

Total MD embraces a diverse coaching and patient population. We encourage any student that is interested in data collection in the health field to apply and receive hands on experience to coaching.

Essential Functions:

Students will be tasked with remote data collection and analysis activities.

Tasks could Include data collection, data transfer, and data analysis work.

Students may also be in contact with patients involved in scheduling or programing.

Students may also be helping with content creation such has multimedia projects and videos.

Specific skills and knowledge students(s) may gain from working on this research:

Telehealth applications, research methodology, EHR/EMR data collection, data organization, data analysis, grant writing, manuscript and conference communication preparation.

Neogens solutions are critical to the health and well-being of our customers operations and in turn their consumers. What we do matters! Learning ISO 17025 policies and procedures as well as daily use of our LIMS based software. Special projects will also be assigned as determined by Lab Services Manager and Quality Manager. Experience needed: Science based emphasis with college lab experience and desire to learn new processes and technology. Degree requirements: Science based discipline.

position: EMAIL AND SOCIAL MEDIA MARKETING: MENTAL HEALTH & WELLNESSS
description:
INTERNSHIP DESCRIPTION

Forward-thinking, fast-paced company is looking for interns with strong knowledge and experience in content marketing using email and social media.

IWE is currently developing new courses and will soon launch an email and social media campaign.

Interns for this position need strong critical thinking and collaboration skills; a superb ability to communicate powerfully in clear, concise English; and a passion for helping others help themselves.

Join an amazing and caring team of super capable people from all over the country, who are dedicated to producing best-in-class work that transforms lives.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Curate and repurpose existing course content for digital marketing campaigns
Contribute to new website pages
Monitor and post on blogs, forums, and social networks
Assist with online outreach and promotion using Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter, and more
Optimize website and social media
Perform keyword analysis

REQUIREMENTS

Marketing/Business or Language major
2 years of experience with Internet and social media platforms
Energetic and creative
Hard-working and team-oriented

﻿BENEFITS

Practical experience with content marketing using email and social media
Shadowing, mentoring, and training opportunities with experienced, knowledgeable professionals
Opportunity to work in close collaboration with a wide range of smart, generous, talented people
Flexible schedule for students
All remote work

If you are a student and/or a professional looking for an internship that is going to make a difference in your life--and your career--in more ways than you can imagine, keep reading.

People who interned this year with the Institute for Wellness Education (IWE) said that the internship was “life-changing,” “incredible,” “amazing,” “better than they ever dreamed,” and “an experience they will carry with them forever.”

IWE’s internship offers you an invaluable opportunity to work with other smart people who are passionate about learning, gaining powerful skills, and helping others.

WHY INTERN WITH US?

IWE’s mission is to help communities live longer, healthier, and happier lives by training helping healthcare and social service professionals and community activists to use a science-based system to help others improve their wellbeing. IWE focuses on two critical factors that contribute to positive, sustainable behavior change: the language of caring that invites others into their own self-change process and the science of behavior change.

Our approach is human-to-human and heart-to-heart.

The system we teach is evidence-based using a biopsychosocial-spiritual model. It's person-centered, strength-based, solution-focused, and outcomes-driven.

The people we train come from local, state, and federal agencies working with vulnerable populations. Our training helps them not only improve lives, but save them, too.

WHAT THE INTERNSHIP IS ABOUT

Interns work on content marketing and curriculum development for online and live courses in health and wellness coaching, trauma-informed social services, addiction recovery, and teen mental health.

What you’ll learn: 

Curriculum design and development
Social media and email content marketing
A way to write that is clear, direct, powerful, and persuasive

Details

Date of internship: Flexible
Hours per week: 12-15
Duration of internship: Minimum 8 weeks with possible extension
Structure: Independent tasks, team projects, quick daily meetings
Apps and platforms we use: Zoom, GroupMe, Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Canvas, TalentMS, Google Drive, Descript, Canva, Powtoons, EdPuzzle, Late

NOTE: This is an unpaid internship, but students who successfully complete it are eligible for a scholarship to one of IWE's tuition-based courses.

WORK REMOTE

We were founded as a virtual company, so "go-remote" is in our blood. Our founders live in New Jersey, California, and Australia. Our staff is in the US, Canada, and the Philippines. And our students have come from all over the world, including the US, Spain, Germany, the UK, Saudi Arabia, Japan, Ghana, Barbados, Russia, Hong Kong, Thailand, and Rwanda.

TO APPLY

Send brief COVER LETTER and resume/CV. Please make sure they are formatted as PDFs.

Nonviolence International New York is looking for an intern illustrator to join our MMIW team. As an illustrator, you will be collaborating with our MMIW team to create all the visual illustrations, flyers, outreach posters, and other needs for our campaign.

This project will be a 6-month project where we are working with Indigenous communities and advocacy groups to create and put on an MMIW March, on May 5th, to advocate for the changing of laws and support for the Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women and Girls campaign. We are hoping to create a team that will focus on the creation and outreach to make this march as impactful as possible. This march will be in person in the New York area however we hope to develop a way to incorporate a virtual aspect for more attendance.

To learn about the efforts that this team has done in the past few semesters please check out our team page at www.nonviolenceny.org/mmiw

Previous experience or interest in learning about Indigenous rights, MMIW, and advocating for their culture.

Our ideal candidate should have either a consistent style or the ability to create one for our projects with clear line art. We are not requiring the illustrations to be done through computer programs (a.k.a Adobe) on the computer but the illustrator should have the tools they need to get the project ready for the team to use their work (even if that means mixing media paper and drawing pens). We want someone who can collaborate with a team and is willing to take on both big projects where the entire videos are hand-drawn to single illustrations for the social media or website.

position: Intern - Business Analyst - Summer 2022 - Remote or Nationwide
description: **ABOUT LUMEN** Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies. **THE ROLE** Lumen’s Internship Program is a path for career readiness in the 4th Industrial Revolution.  Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology.  During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time.  Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. Interns will connect to our company culture through community outreach projects, engage with our employee resource groups and be able to develop their professional skills and business acumen through frequent exposure to senior leadership, cutting-edge technology, groundbreaking projects, and a network of mentors and fellow interns. Come Intern with us and create the beginnings of a career right for YOU!  The Experience  •    Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems  •    Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects •    Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. •    Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.   **THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES** As a Business Analyst Intern in our North America Operations organization, you will work collaboratively with our automation operations team to handle automation opportunities across the business and within North American Operations. Tasks during the 10 weeks will have impact on the business through the process of Review, approve, plan, document and implement automation opportunities for NAO. Business Analyst interns will have the potential to create and improve our processes through data research and solution suggestions. The ideal intern will have technical skills with common languages in the industry.  You will need a high level of engagement and ability to take initiative, ask questions and work in a team environment. - Responsible for conducting or assisting in the documentation of simple to moderate business analysis projects under direct supervision - Works with other team members and subject matter experts to resolve certain questions that are received - Responsible for understanding source data structures and models, producing raw data, data mining, data compilation, completing a variety of analyses (many times using disparate data sources), and creating effective presentations to answer the complex questions posed by the business - Communication expertise, process documentation, exploration, and requirements gathering jobs - Scheduling and hosting business meetings with other team members and business clients as necessary - Producing meeting notes after the call to all stakeholders   **WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE** Education Requirements  -      Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, rising senior level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – May 2023. -   Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Business, Finance, Management, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field Proficiency and understanding of:  - Strong Microsoft Suite knowledge -    Reporting/data expertise is a plus  -    Conduct detailed data analysis and develops reports Microsoft Office suite (Excel with Analysis Toolpack functions, pivot and chart wizards; PowerPoint; Word; Access; Project) and other reporting and data analysis tools -    PowerBI experience is a plus  -    SQL writing expertise is a plus -    Jira/Confluence is a plus      Professional Attributes -        Strong drive for results and taking initiative -    Attention to detail with good organizational capabilities.  -    Ability to prioritize with good time management skills. -    Solid understanding of a particular technology discipline and is proactive in seeking out learning opportunities. -    Good problem-solving skills and ability to methodically work through complex issues. -    Curious Minded- must be able to question the norm -    Ability to take direction and produce results from it -    Ability to be inquisitive, critical thinking, and adaptable -    Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions -    Excellent ability to effectively generate cross-departmental cooperation between operational groups, business product units, process and systems professionals. -    Exceptional ability to develop successful relationships at all levels in a professional, diligent and courteous manner.  -    Strong written and verbal communication skills  Work Setting -    Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Remote- Work From Home -    Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June – August) -    Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations)   **WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT** After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you! We do not tolerate unlawful discrimination in any employment decisions, including recruiting, hiring, compensation, promotion, benefits, discipline, termination, job assignments or training. **DISCLAIMER** The above job definition information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.  Job duties and responsibilities are subject to change based on changing business needs and conditions.

position: Biological Technician - U.S. Military Veterans Only
description:
U.S. Military Veterans! Are you interested in starting a career with the U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service? Keep reading to learn more about this great veteran-only (paid) internship opportunity.

Position Summary: In partnership with the Mt. Adams Institute (MAI), the Columbia River Gorge National Fish Hatchery Complex will sponsor a VetsWork AmeriCorps Intern to serve as a Biological Science Technician. The position will assist with all aspects of salmon production at the Little White Salmon National Fish Hatchery. The primary function of this facility is to collect adult salmon, spawn and rear them for release each year. The salmon are a vital resource for a tribal and recreational fishery as well as a large contribution to the commercial ocean fishery. Our purpose is to replace salmon that were lost due to diminished spawning habitat upon completion of the Bonneville Dam 1938. Every job the Intern will perform contributes to the success of this facility and its ability to provide salmon for harvest. The Columbia River Gorge National Fish Hatchery Complex consists of six facilities, and there will be opportunities to assist each facility as needed.

Member Benefits Include:

Monthly AmeriCorps living stipend
Free housing
AmeriCorps education award
Student loan forbearance
Basic medical insurance (covers members only; vision and dental not included).
Child care allowance for those who qualify.
Access to G.I. Bill benefits of up to approximately $2,400 per month. Actual benefits vary by individuals’ qualified benefits.
Professional development, trainings, certifications and networking opportunities.

Essential Functions (to include, but not limited to):

· Providing standard feeds to fish according to specific schedules following established protocols.

· Observing fish to monitor their behavior and appearance for signs of stress or disease.

· Cleaning and maintaining fish raceways.

· Spawning adult fish.

· Transporting/transferring eggs and fish.

· Grounds maintenance to include improvement projects (use of some power tools, yard work, painting).

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

Service Site - Spring Creek National Fish Hatchery

Comply with all Partner Organizations safety policies and procedures.
Must have a valid driver's license, clean driving record and ability to provide documentation.
Willingness to communicate with the public.
Ability and willingness to serve outdoors in inclement weather with possible strenuous and repetitive physical activity and ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
Demonstrate attention to detail when collecting and recording data.
Demonstrate a desire to promote environmental stewardship.

AmeriCorps

· Must have served in US Armed Forces and have a DD214 with an honorable discharge.

· At least 21 years of age at beginning of service term.

· U.S. citizen, national or lawful permanent resident.

· Possession of a high school diploma or equivalent, or commit to earning one prior to receiving education award.

· Ability to commit to the full 45-week term of service.

· Selection, placement and retention are contingent upon passing the National Sex Offender Public Registry, state of service and state of residence criminal history check and a national FBI check.

COVID-19 Policy - Selected applicants will be required to follow the policies at their service site including any changes that are implemented throughout the course of the program. These policies may include vaccination or regular testing mandates (federal sites), masking / social distancing mandates, remote / virtual work, altered field duties and other restrictions determined necessary to keep site staff, partners and the public safe. Accepting a position means accepting the current requirements and any updates to those requirements while you are enrolled in the program.

position: USDA-ARS Postdoctoral Fellowship in Insect Ecology
description:
*Applications may be reviewed on a rolling-basis and this posting could close before the deadline.

ARS Office/Lab and Location: A research opportunity is currently available with the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), Agricultural Research Service (ARS), Tropical Crop and Commodity Protection Research Unit located in Hilo, Hawaii.

The Agricultural Research Service (ARS) is the U.S. Department of Agriculture's chief scientific in-house research agency with a mission to find solutions to agricultural problems that affect Americans every day from field to table. ARS will deliver cutting-edge, scientific tools and innovative solutions for American farmers, producers, industry, and communities to support the nourishment and well-being of all people; sustain our nation’s agroecosystems and natural resources; and ensure the economic competitiveness and excellence of our agriculture. The vision of the agency is to provide global leadership in agricultural discoveries through scientific excellence.

Research Project: In support of the overall mission of the Tropical Crop and Commodity Protection Research unit, the postdoctoral fellow will pursue research and training related to the development and enhancement of sustainable pest monitoring and management strategies against key arthropod pests of macadamia nuts in Hawaii, including but not limited, to macadamia felted coccid (MFC), Cryptophlebia spp. and tropical nut borer (TNB). The development of these management strategies hinges upon a good understanding of insect behavior and ecology. Thus, the planned postdoctoral research may include activities pertaining to the identification of the sex pheromone of MFC, assessment of volatiles attractive to Cryptophlebia spp. spp and TNB.

Learning Objectives: The specific training activities will include participation in experimental design, set-up of behavioral and chemical ecology lab bioassays (e.g., volatile collection, EthoVision, olfactometer), conducting field experiments, data collection and analysis. The postdoctoral fellow will be given opportunities to showcase research findings to stakeholders via grower meetings, and to scientific audiences through professional conferences (e.g., ESA National Meeting, ESA Branch Meeting, Hawaiian Entomological Society). In addition, the fellow will have opportunities to publish research findings in peer-reviewed journals. The postdoctoral participant will gain valuable experience in interacting with growers, extension specialist and agents, and collaborate with other research scientists working in similar study systems. Overall, this postdoctoral fellowship will offer enhanced scientific and analytical skills for lab and field-based experiments; and provide opportunities for collaborative research and valuable research experience in insect ecology and IPM involving perennial orchard cropping systems.

Mentor(s): The mentor for this opportunity is Angelita Acebes-Doria (Angelita.acebes-doria@usda.gov). If you have questions about the nature of the research please contact one of the mentors.

Anticipated Appointment Start Date: February 2022.  Start date is flexible and will depend on a variety of factors.

Appointment Length: The appointment will initially be for one year, but may be renewed upon recommendation of ARS and is contingent on the availability of funds.

Level of Participation: The appointment is full-time.

Participant Stipend: The participant will receive a monthly stipend commensurate with educational level and experience. A relocation allowance will also be provided to the selected candidate to offset the costs associated with relocating to Hilo, Hawaii.

Citizenship Requirements: This opportunity is available to U.S. citizens, Lawful Permanent Residents (LPR), and foreign nationals. Non-U.S. citizen applicants should refer to the Guidelines for Non-U.S. Citizens Details page of the program website for information about the valid immigration statuses that are acceptable for program participation.

ORISE Information: This program, administered by ORAU through its contract with the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) to manage the Oak Ridge Institute for Science and Education (ORISE), was established through an interagency agreement between DOE and ARS. Participants do not become employees of USDA, ARS, DOE or the program administrator, and there are no employment-related benefits. Proof of health insurance is required for participation in this program. Health insurance can be obtained through ORISE.

Questions: Please visit our Program Website. After reading, if you have additional questions about the application process please email USDA-ARS@orau.org and include the reference code for this opportunity.
company: Oak Ridge Institute for Science and Education

Our associates are at the heart of delivering that promise, so we promise that same human understanding to each other. Come where culture is everything. Interns typically work a full-time schedule throughout a 10-12 week assignment. This position is limited to working 899 hours per service credit year. 3M provides eligible interns with temporary housing and round-trip travel reimbursement in accordance with current policy. This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military environments to a 3M career. The Impact You'll Make in this Role As a Finance Intern you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by: + Addressing relevant business concerns through both individual and team-oriented projects + Participating in a highly developed new employee roundtable connecting you with numerous events and networks + Taking advantage of initial and ongoing training opportunities and exposure to senior leadership Assignment Areas include: + Business Finance Counsel: Assigned responsibility for a business segment, product line, plant, or staff organization to provide business counsel, analysis and financial recommendations. + Auditing: Assigned to one or more auditing teams to perform audits in specific organizations or audit process improvement projects. + Business Accounting: Assigned projects to improve global financial accounting processes or assigned responsibility for a process or business segment to provide accurate, efficient and timely financial reporting, analysis and participate in process standardization. + Treasury: Specific projects to assess and make recommendations on investment or risk management strategies. + Plant Analyst Center: Assigned projects to analyze a given improvement opportunity in US Plant Financial Analyst Center that would either create, standardize or optimize processes or reporting for US plant financial support. + Insights & Analytics: Apply programming skills and advanced statistical modelling techniques to large quantities of data to deliver insights into major finance questions and problems. + Other: Assignments in Tax or Corporate Accounting. Your Skills and Expertise To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications: + Currently pursuing bachelor's degree, from an accredited institution Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include: + Currently pursuing a bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, mathematics, economics, business, information systems or a related field from an accredited institution + Completed a minimum of sophomore year (4 semesters) by the start of the internship + Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale + Demonstrate high ethical standards and leadership abilities. + Demonstrate interpersonal, communication, and team skills Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status). Supporting school management.

Leadership and willingness to be a leader.
Interested in English education and communication with different kinds of people especially kids.
Programming knowledge is not necessary, but if you have it, it is a big plus.
Knowledge about IB, design, music, dance, science or math is a plus.
Be passionate, energetic, hard working, and have a can do attitude.

Who We Are

National Research Group (NRG) is a leader in data driven insights and strategic consultation to the global technology and entertainment industries. Working at the confluence of technology, content, and culture, NRG offers bold insights for storytellers everywhere. Our consultants have experience working across all facets of technology and media.

Why You'll Love It Here

We are inspired by working with storytellers that challenge us to think differently and see the world in new ways. As a result, our business is driven by creative, curious, and inventive people who have a passion for culture and technology. We work as a collective across disciplines and geographies to bring together the best thinking for every assignment, delivering insights to bold storytellers everywhere.

The Opportunity

We are seeking a Vice President or Senior Vice President to join our Platforms & Technology Practice to lead and grow a team focused on User Experience Research In this role, you will have the opportunity to help establish and grow a new practice area within NRG's Platforms & Technology team, building on our strong understanding of the technology space, deep existing relationships with many leading technology companies, and proven abilities in telling data-driven stories that help clients transform their businesses. In this role, you will shape the vision for NRG's unique value proposition and capabilities in the User Experience Research space, and help grow the team and client base to support it.

You will bring your intellectual curiosity, entrepreneurial mindset, and storytelling ability to lead the team, and consultatively engage with clients. If you're passionate about User Experience Research; if you want the innovate how research is done in this space; if you are excited about the opportunity to shape the product design strategies of the world's largest technology companies; if you possess a natural ability to visualize data and bring it to life; if you enjoy being a trusted consultant to technology clients – this opportunity is for you!

The Role

Launch and set the vision for a team that will deliver best-in-class, highly consultative User Experience Research, while disrupting traditional approaches to research in this space.
Provide account development, management, and team leadership for our business focused on User Experience Research, with leading technology and platform clients.
Lead team execution and timely delivery on all aspects of primary User Experience research, including both qualitative and quantitative methods, with a strong emphasis on delivering innovative insights and results with impact.
Develop, grow, and manage relationships with clients, focusing on leading technology clients and other forward-looking companies across industries. Previous experience with technology clients is important, and preference is for an existing network of contacts that can be leveraged, alongside NRG's existing relationships.
Coach, manage, motivate, and inspire a team of exceptional researchers to deliver best in class research programs, and continue to build out an extraordinary team via adept talent identification and recruitment.
Anticipate client needs through intimate familiarity with their business, their unique challenges/opportunities.
Proactively engage with clients on a continual basis to help foster a sense of partnership and to generate business opportunity.
Work collaboratively with the larger data processing / data sciences / development teams to constantly optimize and develop products, service models, and execution. Maintain a constant emphasis on improvement and innovation in order to demonstrate lasting value.
Serve as a trusted expert in technology and other trends impacting clients' business, staying abreast of product, service, and competitive developments.

Who You Are

8+ years' experience working in a relevant User Experience Research field, at a supplier side firm, or in a UXR role at a media/technology company (ideally some combination thereof.)
Degree-level qualification with a strong academic record, ideally in a field such as business, marketing, market research or social science.
Excellent PowerPoint, Excel, and written and visual communication skills.
Strong interest and experience in technology and social media.
Passionate about data-driven approach and can think strategically to draw out big picture correlations, predictions, and recommendations.
Strong storytelling and data visualization capabilities.
Ability to drive thought leadership research to help build NRG's profile as a trusted and innovative research provider in the UXR space.

Ideal Candidate

This is an end-to-end leadership role, but strong business/account development background is imperative, along with well-developed research acumen.
The optimal candidate will bring a portfolio of client relationships, along with leveraging NRG's existing client network.
Internally-motivated self-starter who continuously strives to get things done, regardless of challenges encountered.
Critical thinker, able to respond to complex questions from clients and lead the development of research plans, and deliver game-changing insights.
Team player who is able to work collaboratively.
Passion for research and, in particular, custom UXR projects, in multiple areas of specialization/across the product and services lifecycle.
Upholding and showing leadership around NRG's core values of excellence, innovation, collaboration, enthusiasm, and grit.

Position Type

This position is potentially responsible for supervising 1-10 Interns, Analysts, Managers, and/or Directors. This is a team leadership role and is a full-time exempt position

Work Environment

NRG provides flexible work options – employees will be given the choice to work remotely, work out of a designated office (Culver City or New York) or a hybrid of the two. This role routinely uses standard office equipment.

Required Application Materials:

Resume
Cover Letter which should include:
What excites you most about this position
What should excite NRG most about you, as a candidate for this position

The Opportunity

We are looking for a passionate certified Data Analyst. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. The Program is classified as UNPAID and is for learning practical hands-on experience in a professional business setting leading to marketable skills. A self-investing benefit for competing during job searches and future interviews.

Duties & Responsibilities

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
