position: Website Property Design, Marketing, Social Media, SEO and Publishing
description:
Job Description:

As businesses continue to use the internet to market their products and services, they must keep pace with ever-changing technologies and strategies. This program teaches the internet marketing techniques that businesses use to improve the efficiency of their virtual advertising. Students will learn how to build and market brands with specific examples of what works and does not work in web marketing. Learn software use in WordPress, PHP Fox, Weebly, Standout, Conversion Bot, HTML and more. After learning the basics, students will move on learning how the marketing process works in planning, executing, pricing, promotion, distribution, and maintaining long-term relationships with customers. The entertainment companies have 15 real-world internet properties to choose from. This will be a remote work position, interns can check in between Sept. 7-20 for Fall 2021.

Responsibilities:

E-Commerce, MySQL, search engine optimization
Desktop publishing and design production
Create and implement banner ad programs
Create presentations for potential clients
Work with existing internet property
Internet promotion and marketing

Position: Program Manager, Custom
Reports To: Executive Director, Custom Programs
Department: Custom Programs
Location: Portland, Maine; Boston; Remote

About the Company:

Council on International Education and Exchange (CIEE) is a nonprofit study abroad and intercultural exchange organization that transforms lives and builds bridges between individuals and nations through study abroad and international exchange experiences that help people develop skills for living in a globally interdependent and culturally diverse world.

Summary of Position:

CIEE is looking for someone to join a passionate, innovative, and growing team that partners with higher education institutions to provide students with impactful international learning experiences. The Program Manager will serve in a consultative sales role to higher education study abroad staff, career offices, faculty, department chairs, and deans. This role is responsible for all aspects of sales and program planning for faculty-led, internship, and custom semester programs. Based upon his/her portfolio, he/she will be responsible for meeting and exceeding annual sales goals with the aim to provide the highest quality student experiences for U.S. colleges and universities.

Primary Responsibilities:
Manage an active pipeline of program opportunities to meet annual sales goals
Build strong, lasting relationships with partners by understanding their needs and objectives
Acquire and maintain a working knowledge of CIEE’s study abroad and global internship programs and locations
Oversee creation of program proposals and build and maintain program budgets
Execute internal processes for program sales, design, operations, pricing, pre-departure, and delivery in collaboration with Enrollment, Academic Affairs, Finance, Global Operations, and other teams
Collaborate with Institutional Relations to secure new program leads and new institutional partnerships
Facilitate information sharing between higher education institutions and CIEE global staff
Maintain and improve communications systems between global and U.S. CIEE staff
Attend industry conferences (NAFSA, Forum, CIEE Conference, etc.) to sell and promote CIEE’s Custom Programs
Collaborate with Program Administrator(s) on creation of training materials and manuals for global staff
Assist with special projects and other tasks as necessary to ensure smooth operation of Custom Programs

Skills and Experience:
Bachelors degree
Minimum 3+ years of solution sales, account management, or partnership development experience
Experience working with faculty or within higher education preferred
Self-motivated, collaborative, responsible, and passionate about exceeding partner expectations
Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and perform effectively in ambiguous environments
Strong communication, presentation, and relationship management skills
Ability to remain calm in a fast-paced work environment with tight deadlines
Exceptional attention to detail, organizational, and time management skills
Ability to learn new processes quickly and take initiative
Ability to travel ~10% of the time
Study abroad experience preferred
Experience with Salesforce preferred

Diversity Matters:

CIEE believes that diversity matters and that professionals with diverse backgrounds provide diverse approaches and ideas to solving problems and finding ways to advance our mission to bring the world together. Candidates from underrepresented groups with diverse backgrounds and experiences are strongly encouraged to apply.

Why you should consider working for us:
You will change the world. CIEE builds bridges between different people, different countries, and different cultures. We help young people participate in high-quality international exchange and study abroad programs that bring the world together. We change lives, our alumni change the world. Be part of the change!
You will be fairly compensated. CIEE strives to provide all employees with competitive salaries and exceptional benefits. Benefits include excellent healthcare insurance; annual contributions to your retirement fund of up to 5% of your salary; generous personal time off, including vacation, holidays, and floating Fridays; and a full suite of insurance, including life, travel, short-term, and long-term disability insurance.
You will be part of a fast-paced, international, diverse, and collaborative team of professionals. CIEE operates the largest nonprofit network of study abroad locations, with facilities and staff in 26 countries. Additionally, we help international participants from over 130 countries come to the USA each year. Committed to excellence and solving whatever problem the world throws at them, CIEE professionals work on international teams, and are dedicated to advancing our 75-year-old mission to make the world a more peaceful place.
Due to federal regulations a background check will be conducted as a condition of employment.

Why Copy Solutions?

- Receive academic credit

o Applicable to most internship programs at California universities. We will verify your hours for credit and complete any necessary forms/surveys.

- Real-world professional experience

o Gain first-hand professional experience working under Xerox, a Fortune-500 company.

- Resume building

o Have a leg up on the competition before graduating with professional experience on your resume.

- Recommendation Letter

o Upon completion of our internship program, you can receive a recommendation letter based on your performance.

- Apply your coursework and experience to a professional work environment

o Develop your professional communication skills, network, and learn real business processes.

- Choose your schedule

o We can accommodate to your busy class schedule, as long as you complete 20 hours a week from the office!

Responsibilities:

- Work with a mentor who will guide you through completing daily business administration-related tasks

- Provide variety of administrative support such as conducting research, gathering data, preparing spreadsheets, and other similar functions

- Assist with data entry, filing, mailing, and organizing documents

- Provide customer and employee support

- Learn about the company’s mission and available products/ services

- Facilitate other responsibilities administrated by upper management

The National Center for Youth Law (NCYL) works to build a future in which every child thrives and has a full and fair opportunity to achieve the future they envision for themselves. We focus on complex challenges that disproportionately impact children and communities of color and on solutions that require multiple public systems to change their policies, practices and culture.  

William Lee “Bill” Grimm, Senior Director at the National Center for Youth Law, was a public impact attorney who worked for 43 years transforming and redeeming some of the most troubled child welfare systems in America. To honor him and his powerful legacy, in partnership with his family and friends, we have created the Bill Grimm Memorial Summer Clerk Program. Read more about Bill here.  

Position  

The National Center for Youth Law is committed to hiring clerks who reflect the racial and cultural diversity of our clients. Students of color, those who will increase the diversity of NCYL, and those with personal experience in our practice areas are strongly encouraged to apply. 

NCYL seeks two (2) policy-focused students to support its Oakland, California office during Summer 2022. Under the mentorship of their supervising legal or policy staff members, Policy Clerks will work on projects impacting low-income children and youth.  

The Oakland office’s staff includes policy, legal, and direct services staff. Policy and legal staff work on cases and campaigns in multiple states, including work focused on the foster care system, juvenile justice, education, immigration, commercial sexual exploitation of children, and health access and equity.  

Stipend 

Program participants will receive a stipend of $2000 to defray living expenses. 

How to Apply 

Applications will be reviewed until the positions are filled or until January 14, 2022. Applicants must submit the following: 

Resume (not including GPA) 
Cover letter describing your particular interest in working for NCYL and understanding of NCYL’s mission 
Approximately 5-page writing sample that demonstrates policy advocacy skills  

NCYL will not participate in regional or school-based career fairs taking place after the January 14 deadline if all clerk spots have been filled. All students are encouraged to apply as early as they are permitted to do so by their schools. 

Apply at: 

https://recruiting.paylocity.com/recruiting/jobs/Details/818050/National-Center-For-Youth-Law/2022-Summer-Oakland-Policy-Clerk-Program 

NCYL is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, age, ethnic background, sex, disability, size, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, color, marital status, personal appearance, family responsibilities, matriculation, or genetic information.

Job Information Gartner Sales Intern Program Manager in United States Search Jobs Keyword Search City, State or Country Search Sales Intern Program Manager London, United Kingdom Apply (https://gartner.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/EXT/job/London/Sales-Intern-Program-Manager_55285) Save Job Job Saved Job Description: What makes Gartner HR a GREAT fit for you? When you become a member of Gartner HR, youll join a fast-paced, dynamic team. Youll play a key role in our companys continued double-digit growth. From talent acquisition and management to compensation, benefits, analytics and operations, finding and keeping the right people is what drives our continued success. Come to work every day excited by smart and creative colleagues and the chance to innovate and grow. If you love working with people and making the connection between great talent and company success, we want to connect with you. About this Role: The Sales Intern Program Manager role is key to executing on Gartners investment with early career talent; building best in class internship programs that foster conversion opportunities. The Sales Intern Program Manager will play a key role in executing the intern program including intern housing and all other logistics of the program. This individual must deliver strong results in a fast-paced, demanding environment with the ability to flex priorities and adapt to change. Effective verbal and written communication skills are key in this role, as well as the ability to manage others, work independently and prioritize tasks. What youll do: * Manage & oversee summer & other interns in in other locations across Spain and the UK * Coordination of intern housing and all other logistics of the program including ownership of the housing relationships * Support creation of marketing content for program * Own execution of Sales keep warm strategy i.e. continuous engagement with intern participants * Support and organize intern outings * Coordinate Sales specific workshops and training * Handle collection and implementation of program feedback surveys What youll need: * Bachelors' degree and experience in Campus Recruiting and/or Talent Acquisition with specific focus in Sales recruiting * Proven experience supporting Campus and/or Intern programs * Ability to manage people, projects and timelines and partner with remote stakeholders * Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office suite including, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook. Who you are: * High energy and collaborative * Detail-oriented and organized * Creative thinker and problem solver * Proactive in regards to anticipating needs What we offer: * A seat to the table to help drive peak performance in a growing, people business. * Encouragement to be innovative and challenge status quo. * Exposure to industry leading training and development. * Performance based recognition and rewards. Who are we? Gartner delivers actionable, objective insight to executives and their teams. Our expert guidance and tools enable faster, smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organizations most critical priorities. Weve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have nearly 16,000 associates globally that support our 14,000+ clients in more than 100 countries . What makes Gartner a great place to work? Our teams are composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations. We believe that a variety of experiences makes us strongeras individuals, as communities and as an organization. Thats why we're recognized worldwide as a great place to work year after year. We've been recognized by Fortune as one of the Worlds Most Admired Companies, named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion by the Disability Equality Index. Looking for a place to turn your big ideas into reality? Join #LifeAtGartner What we offer: Our people are our most valuable asset, so we invest in them from Day 1. When you join our team, youll have access to a vast array of benefits to help you live your life well. These resources are designed to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. We encourage continued personal and professional growth through ongoing learning and development opportunities. Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you. The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity. Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Companys career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at 203-964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com. Job Requisition ID:55285 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence. Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

Responsibilities

Position Summary: We are looking for an enthusiastic business development intern to grow our presence in middle and high schools 

As a business development intern, you will work directly with the founder and CEO, Patrina Mack (https://www.linkedin.com/in/visionandexecution0patrinamack/), recently recognized as a Woman of Influence by the San Jose Business Journal and a noted Silicon Valley expert in bringing new business to market. Working with direct supervision you will be responsible for business development/partnership development to establish our presence in schools and PTA organizations. 

Key Responsibilities: 

• Marketing communications/Growth hacking 

o Customer acquisition and management 

o Engaging with influencers and thought leaders via social media using Hootsuite 

o Advertising on social media, partner sites, promotions, contests, giveaways 

o E-mail campaigns to partners and prospects using MailChimp 

o Partner management and prospecting using HubSpot, which includes prospect scoring, grading and segmentation 

o Managing B2B2C Engagement Programs such as with school districts, school guidance counselor associations, private schools and PTAs chapters 

o Measure and report to CEO on program effectivenesss, assess performance against goals. 

o Craft knowledge management responses to frequently asked questions for this segment for website 

o Gather competitive intelligence on direct and indirect competitors to help provide guidance relative to product positioning, pricing, and promotion 

o Help QA new features

Music Addict is looking for Interns for our Music Reviews, Full Service Record label, our radio interview show, our music TV Show seen in 190 countries, for our music magazine which launched in Jan 2019 and for our entertainment Consulting firm. We are looking for aggressive interns who want to learn the media and music business. Music Addict/MI5 Recordings is looking for qualified candidates who want to learn about music, entertainment and the media industry.

Set up and participate in A&R Campaign development meetings.
Learn how a record label works
Work as part of a larger team to expand Music Addict/MI5 Recordings presence in social media and the music industry.
Conduct research on music artists and music/entertainment events
Draft correspondence/emails to music/entertainment representatives as needed
Monitor Music/Social media issues that impact the company
Assist with logistics for community outreach events and programs and participate as needed.
Write Music industry articles and features on our website
All other duties as assigned.
Work with Our Music Review staff on music artist reviews releases/articles
Work with our Radio and TV staff on programs
Work with Consulting staff on current projects

Music career goals with either production, record label or artists, Journalism for writing, research and editing for magazine or songwriting, music engineering or production, record label management, interviewing for radio or tv. Hosting for radio or tv, social media or consulting back rounds or interests, public relations, entertainment management, Data and analytics back round for the record label and Marketing for all media

position: 2022 L’Oreal USA HR Summer Internship – Undergraduate
description: At L'Oréal, whether you are an intern, manager, or senior leader, **the most valuable asset we have is you.** Your unique sense of curiosity, creative mindset, and desire to innovate are what we expect you to bring with you every day. The L’Oréal USA Summer Internship Program is a **paid, 11-week experience** where you will be fully integrated into the day-to-day activities of a team while also **leading your own, individual strategic project** to discover what it is truly like to develop a career at the #1 Beauty Tech company in the world. We are committed to giving our interns the space to explore, to have full time employee responsibilities, present their own insights to senior management, and to become future leaders. At the end of the summer, you will present your project to senior leadership for the **opportunity to be considered for a full-time return offer into a Management Trainee program or a full-time role**. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis, so it is highly encouraged to apply soon. We encourage students of diverse backgrounds to apply, including, but not limited to race, ethnicity, gender expression, LGBTQ+, military status, and people with disabilities. **What You’ll Do:** - Own an individual project with strategic business impact that you present to senior leaders - Analyze data, identify root causes, and recommend solutions for HR related business issues - Experience hands-on HR generalist responsibilities, working with multiple HRIS and reporting systems - Follow up and solicit feedback from employees on a regular basis with a “customer service” orientation and ability to escalate issues when appropriate - Engage our teams in sharing best HR practices - Network and learn about multiple functions (Marketing, Supply Chain, Finance, R&I and Sales) - Participate in formal and informal training opportunities **The Program:** - This is a paid internship opportunity. Housing assistance is provided on an individual basis based on eligibility per our L'Oréal Relocation Policy. - All interns will be paired with a mentor and a buddy to help guide you through your internship - Professional development & social programming is an integral part of your internship experience to understand our culture. From networking events to trainings, your calendar will always be full! - There are many perks to being a summer intern, but two standout ones are access to our company store that has steep discounts on L’Oréal products and our Summer Friday program – every Friday during your internship is a half day! - Our summer internship is the primary path for consideration into L’Oréal’s full-time HR Management Trainee Program upon graduation and is based on overall performance Being a member of the L’Oréal USA Summer Internship Program, you will feel empowered to contribute in tangible, meaningful ways from day one because **in an organization founded on entrepreneurism and agility, your ideas are not only heard and valued, but they are often put into implementation,** too. As the #1 Beauty Tech company in the world with over 35 international brands – CeraVe, Kiehl’s, Maybelline, and Urban Decay to name just a few – we embrace [++**diversity**++](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/loreal-usa-named-to-highest-level-of-diversity-best-practices-inclusion-index-300892650.html) **and inclusion,** [++**sustainability**++](https://www.loreal.com/en/commitments-and-responsibilities/for-the-planet/)**,** [++**innovation**++](https://gizmodo.com/loreals-newest-skincare-gadget-is-even-cooler-in-person-1840868712)**, and** [++**well-being**++](https://www.wayup.com/guide/community/loreal-2468-sponsored-helping-communities-covid-19/) in the workplace to lay the groundwork for you to be able to accomplish great things. You can explore our internship program and hear directly from our past interns at [++lorealoncampus.com++](http://file//fsusnas16/CORPNY_Recruiting/Campus%20Recruitment%20Initiatives/Campus%20Recruitment/2020-2021%20Season/Internship%20Program%20Job%20Descriptions/lorealoncampus.com). Freedom to go beyond, that’s the beauty of L’Oréal - Are you ready?

Job Description:

Sports Media, Inc. is seeking individuals with the right analytical skills. This intern will also be responsible for generating the reports necessary to plan and evaluate marketing campaigns. You will partner with the marketing coordinator to identify opportunities and design programs to increase exposure and sales. The ideal candidate will bring a well-rounded business perspective to our campaign planning process. This will be a remote work position, interns can check in between Sept. 7-20 for Fall 2021.

Responsibilities:

Become knowledgeable with services provided by Sports Media, as well as the marketing philosophy that is employed in sales. 
Become knowledgeable about the functional uses of our services, the markets to which they are sold, the composition of our customer base, and the profiles of our competitors.
Analyze large amounts of primary research data and data from our internal databases to spot trends, identify connections, and draw actionable conclusions from single surveys and across different surveys. 
Become familiar with the attributes of competitive products, the strategies used to market them, and the reason why consumers buy them. 
Investigate and develop new products and programs in current and evolving markets, which help to support corporate sales and profitability.
Development of sales/marketing materials to enhance the sales of existing and new services, which are introduced on a regional, national, or international basis
Spend time working with our sales people to gain market information and discover sales opportunities. 
Use in-house software tools to create and update cloud-based dashboards that enable our stakeholders to access and interact with market research data. 
Ability to dissect, interpret, and draw business-specific conclusions from large amounts of data

PRP Luxury Group Social Media & Marketing Intern program is ideal for a candidate that is majoring in marketing, advertising, or communications. Interns will gain exposure to various aspects of social media marketing but not limited to: Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Instagram and LinkedIn marketing, sales and advertising campaign creation and implementation, social public relations projects, market research and analyzing data.

Learning objectives are achieved through training, observation, and learning by doing under close supervision of the PRP marketing staff with constructive feedback. All duties and responsibilities listed below are facilitated under close observation through a mentor-trainee relationship.

As our Social Media Manager, you will create, research, and post relevant content to Black Connect's social media accounts on Blackconnect.com and Linkedin and engage with followers.

Duties include:

Create and post graphics
Create and post video content
Create captions
Research and share news and information
Engage with followers
Create a monthly content calendar

In this role, you will promote:

our programs
membership benefits
our partnerships
facts on the racial wealth gap in America
Blackconnect.com's features
our podcast
our entrepreneur and small business members
relevant current events
BC's committees

Come join one of the largest HVAC and plumbing companies in the entire Midwest. How did we get here in such a short period of time? We keep on growing because we only hire the best (that's YOU) and our client's love us for it! People often come to us looking for a job. They stay with us because they find a fulfilling career, room to grow, and opportunities to excel. THE BIG TASK The Plumbing Project Install Helper is responsible for repairing plumbing systems together with the Plumbing Install Technician. The Plumbing Project Install Helper works diligently to keep the project running smoothly and profitably with a positive attitude, desire to exceed client expectations and desire to learn the trade. KEY SUB TASKS Repair and replacement of toilets and faucets. Replacement of garbage disposals, water softeners, waterline system, drainage or vent system, tubs, showers, sinks and gas pipe lines. Gas leak detection and proper testing. Replacement of sump and sewage pumps. Install battery backup sump pump systems. Assist Plumbing Lead Installer in maintaining truck inventory. Follow installation procedures and processes. Embrace and proactively seek out development opportunities through continued training and one-on-one coaching. DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE Valid Driver's License. Minimum one year field experience. Available to arrive early and/or stay late when workload requires. WHAT WE OFFER OUR AMAZING TEAM Clearly Outlined Career Path Industry Leading Total Compensation Plans Medical (as low as $1), Dental and Vision Insurance Company Matched Health Savings Account and 401k Retirement Account Employee Personal Loan Program FREE Long-Term Disability Insurance, Employee + Family Life Insurance, Wellness Program and Employee Assistance Program (Mental Health) Voluntary Short-Term Disability Insurance, Accident Insurance and Critical Illness Insurance Six (6) Paid Company Holidays One (1) Paid Community Service Day Company Paid Personal Time Off (Up to 4 Weeks) Company Paid Other Time Off (Bereavement & Jury Duty) Employee Discount (45% OFF) Friends & Family Discount (30% OFF) Industry Leading Training Programs Additional Income Opportunities A place you LOVE to come to work each day and so much more! Do you check the box for the above items? If so, you've found the right place to build upon your career. If you want to be part of something bigger than just a job - make this career move and find exactly what you're looking for. You will work in a place where you will be appreciated by your team and customers, and where your work has a direct effect on the success of the company. If this sounds like you, spend a little time learning about the company by visiting our website. We look forward to speaking with you soon! EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

position: Intern - Project Analyst (Manager) - Summer - CO or Remote
description: ABOUT LUMEN Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies. THE ROLE LUMEN’S INTERNSHIP PROGRAM IS A PATH FOR CAREER READINESS IN THE 4TH INDUSTRIAL REVOLUTION.  Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology.  During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time.  Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. The Experience  -    Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems  -    Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects -    Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. -    Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.   THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES As a Project Manager in our Strategic Planning and Transformation organization, the Intern will work collaboratively with the team that provides back-office support to our Finance & HR stakeholders through the Corporate Product & Platform Engineering Value Stream. In this role, the intern will support leaders and delivery teams in the adoption of SAFe processes and a Lean-Agile mindset. The intern will be preparing project status reports and effectively communicating with internal and external customer project stakeholders,  You will document new business requirements that are clear and concise. Facilitate program meetings to foster a collaborative environment toward problem-solving.  Support Program Increment (PI) Planning readiness, PI events, and PI execution to ensure successful PI execution.     WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE - Education Requirements  -    Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, rising senior or master’s level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – May 2023. -    Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Liberal Arts, Business or Economics or a related field. - Proficiency and understanding of;  -    Excel -    MS Office and MS Teams -    Agile Methodology -    Ability to prioritize tasks under demanding timelines  -    Project Management - Professional Attributes  -    Strong drive for results and taking initiative -    Ability to be resourceful and adaptable -    Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions -    Strong written and verbal communication skills -    Ability to interact with business partners and drive the conversation. -    Flexible and adapts well to change -    Strong self-motivation skills -    Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills  -    Strong facilitation skills  -    Effective decision-making skills  -    Strong verbal and written communication skills Work Setting -    Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Broomfield -CO, Littleton-CO.  May consider remote/ work from home. -    Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June – August) -    Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations) -    US work authorization  WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. At Freddie Mac, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation. _**As part of Freddie Mac’s return to the office pilot, all employees, contingent workers and visitors must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to be on-site unless they have an approved accommodation.**_ **Position Overview:** At Freddie Mac, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation. Launch your career by doing more at Freddie Mac! Our internships and graduate programs give you the opportunity to tackle a variety of challenging roles and make your mark on several projects. From day one, you’ll gain confidence, see your ideas take shape and build a network of people who are invested in your success. We're not just the next step, we’re the right step! **Our Impact:** ERM’s objective is to build strong, effective and efficient risk management in order to help manage risk and capital and the largest financial institutions. We are responsible for independent oversight and assessment of the company’s financial and non-financial risks. We establish and communicate the enterprise risk framework — including corporate risk policies and standards — while promoting a strong risk culture. Our internship offers you the chance to make meaningful contributions to our risk management objectives and provides exposure to a wide spectrum of risk disciplines that will allow you to build on the knowledge and analytical skills you have acquired through your advanced studies. You will work with some of the brightest minds in the financial services industry and develop your knowledge of risk management, all while building valuable skills and making lifelong connections. Upon successful completion of the three-month internship and your advanced degree, you may be extended an opportunity to join our Enterprise Graduate Risk Rotation program – a two-year analyst rotation program that allows you to work in different risk management areas such as Credit, Market and Model risk. Our analyst program is designed to help you build a broad skill set, develop a comprehensive foundation in risk management, and accelerate your career growth by gaining exposure to our enterprise-level risk management function. **Your Impact:** **Project Support** As an intern, you will support short-term projects that contribute to division priorities, which may include one or more of the following activities: - Assist in the assessment of business unit exposures by identifying risks, evaluating their potential impact and reviewing the strengths and weaknesses of the organization's existing controls - Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes - Develop and implement key analytics and other reports - Support strategic planning and change management initiatives - Perform budgeting, forecasting and cost monitoring activities - Work on cross-functional projects and/or teams and assist with project management activities **Professional Development** Participation in the program will support your continued professional development through access to targeted training courses and exposure to senior management. You will gain knowledge of risk management concepts in the financial industry and an understanding of critical organizational business and risk management functions, all while enhancing your own competencies, by: - Building critical leadership, business and analytical skills - Creating your personal brand and growing your internal network - Obtaining support and guidance from dedicated program managers, experienced rotational analysts and knowledgeable mentors - Enhancing your knowledge of financial and risk concepts and Freddie Mac’s key role in the mortgage market through a custom-designed training curriculum - Participating in organized community service events to complement your professional development with personal growth ## Qualifications: - Enrolled in a full-time graduate degree program in business administration (MBA), finance, economics, public policy, law or related subject area - Three to seven years of professional work experience - Graduating in either December 2022 or May 2023 ## Keys to Success in this Role: - Execution focused, with proven initiative, personal accountability and leadership - Strong consultation and influencing skills - Ability to work with and collaborate within a team and across the broader organization - Ability to work independently and adapt in a changing environment - Curiosity to learn and challenge the status quo - Interest or experience in financial markets, securitization, trading of financial products, or loan and security portfolio management **Preferred Skills:** - Proficient in MS Office Suite, specifically Excel and PowerPoint - Experience with Microstrategy and/or Tableau - Strong analytical skills - Experience working with large data sets **Current Freddie Mac employees please apply through the internal career site.** Today, Freddie Mac makes home possible for one in four home borrowers and is one of the largest sources of financing for multifamily housing. Join our smart, creative and dedicated team and you’ll do important work for the housing finance system and make a difference in the lives of others. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will ensure that individuals with differing abilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. Notice to External Search Firms: Freddie Mac partners with BountyJobs for contingency search business through outside firms. Resumes received outside the BountyJobs system will be considered unsolicited and Freddie Mac will not be obligated to pay a placement fee. If interested in learning more, please visit [www.BountyJobs.com](http://www.bountyjobs.com/) and register with our referral code: MAC.

This internship is for Menfes Interactive, UPG's technology consulting arm in service of several clients and

Through our campus recruiting program, we hire a select group of highly motivated summer interns (Undergraduate Class of 2023) with the goal of identifying talent for our Full-time Analyst Program. Our size and structure provides individuals with a high level of responsibility and the unique opportunity to work directly with senior management, joint venture partners, investment bankers, brokers and commercial lenders in all real estate classes. Summer Interns will participate in a variety of specialized trainings that will refine their skills and assist them in transitioning into the professional working environment of Starwood and the investment industry as a whole. A mentorship driven program allows our Summer Interns to create lasting relationships that will support the continued growth of a successful career. Asset Management Intern Qualifications Qualified candidates typically have superior analytical, quantitative, and technical skills, including strong academic records, high standardized test scores, a demonstrated interest in real estate and finance and an unyielding work ethic. Interns will need to display a willingness to take direction and the capacity to quickly learn and develop skills required to become an effective Analyst, including proficiency in financial modeling. We look for team players who feel comfortable working in an entrepreneurial environment. Strong interpersonal and communication skills are essential. Responsibilities Interns will focus on monitoring and reporting asset level performance, identifying potential issues and assisting with existing asset business plan development and implementation. Specific responsibilities include: Performing property and portfolio valuations and return analyses; Conducting market assessments and making recommendations based on results; working on special projects including hold-sell analysis and evaluation of refinancing; Interacting with joint venture partners; Monitoring business plan performance and reacting to correct any variances; Reviewing and reporting on plans, budgets and schedules to identify profit-maximizing opportunities; Assisting the acquisition team with underwriting potential real estate and structured finance acquisitions.

Lead HR team in achieving the following goals below:

Recruit and retain a diverse workforce to meet the needs of the organization.
Administer HR policy and programs effectively while maintaining internal customer satisfaction and meeting budget constraints.
Create and implement employee relations policies to help increase employees & job satisfaction.
Communicate with employees about compensation, benefits and company policies.
Respond to questions or complaints from employees in a timely fashion.
Devise a list of procedures and practices for hiring new employees and managing our staff
Establish an orientation procedure for onboarding new hires and training them to meet the needs of the company
Verify the company is complying with state and federal legal requirements.
Update and ensure documents and spreadsheets are up to date

position: HR Project Specialist - Medical Interventional Division
description:
Collaboration drives Nordson’s success as a market leader in Industrial Precision Solutions and Advanced Technology. Our employees thrive in an environment where we help each other reach our personal best and enable our company to continuously improve and grow, and our customers to succeed. You will find Nordson employees sharing our success by giving back in the communities around the world where we live and work.

Nordson MEDICAL designs, engineers and manufactures complex devices and components with applications in wound healing, surgical and minimally invasive, fluid management, pulmonology and interventional and structural heart. Our pioneering Advanced Polymers team was the first to manufacture and supply medical balloons to the medical device industry. Nordson MEDICAL works with doctors, start-ups and large medical companies around the world at any point in the product lifecycle, from concept to launch and beyond.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities

Talent Development

Identify specific training needs/plans per function, and early in career talent
Identify participants for training and schedule
Coordinate and facilitate training for production employees

Internship/Co-op Program

Coordinate internship program for all of Nordson MEDICAL (year round program)
Target schools, collaborate with COE team to register and identify those by site to attend
Coordinate and create events for interns with leaders
Coordinate report out of projects interns are working on, rotations, etc.
Coordinate and schedule intern presentations (event) to leaders

Production Workforce Planning/Reporting

D&D Quality Quarterly Review Reporting (Terms, New Hires, etc.)
Guidance, administrative support for Grow with Us programs
Recruitment strategies for production employees - develop relationships with high school tech programs, technical colleges, etc.
Open positions reporting, collaborating with Field HR Specialist to fill positions

Coordinates and tracks job descriptions for business group, including assisting managers in creation and ensuring each job title has appropriate description developed

Direct Managers and Employees to HR Operations (Global Business Services) and coordinate with HR Operations where required to ensure provision of high quality HR services

Respond and create on demand report needs from managers and supervisors, compensation reports, org charts, etc.

Perform other duties as assigned

Education and Experience

Education:

Bachelor’s Degree preferred

Experience:

1-3years of progressive professional level human resources experience
HR Generalist work experiences within a manufacturing environment is preferred

Skills and Abilities

Ability to handle multiple priorities with a high degree of flexibility
Ability to demonstrate high energy and persistence in a fast pace work environment
Current knowledge on applicable employment and labor regulations
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent organizational and time management skills – detail oriented
Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Office skills
Ability to maintain confidentiality
Familiarity with HRIS functions particularly Workday

Working Conditions and Physical Demands

Office environment. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Travel Required

Estimated 10%

description: **DESCRIPTION** SHIFT: Day Job SCHEDULE: Full-time _Your Talent. Our Vision._ AT ANTHEM, INC., it’s a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which we’re creating greater care for our members, greater value for our customers, and greater health for our communities. Join us and together we will DRIVE THE FUTURE OF HEALTH CARE.  This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve at one of America's leading health benefits companies and a Fortune Top 50 Company. The Commercial & Specialty Business Division (CSBD) **ETHICS, COMPLIANCE AND PRIVACY (ECP) INTERN** will be responsible for… **_Primary responsibilities:_** - Develop, implement and manage enterprise-wide and departmental CSBD ECP program initiatives to advance Anthem’s CSBD Compliance program. This includes: - Streamlining internal data structure and simplifying reporting processes - Identifying and leading the implementation of continuous improvement project - Mapping out existing process flows for process improvement - Modernizing CSBD Compliance program by applying appropriate technology solutions such as Tableau, Power BI, SharePoint, MS Teams, etc. - Administering offsite storage.  - Develop and administer training to educate target audience on newly designed and improved processes - Interface with senior legal, compliance, technology, data, and financial executives as needed. **QUALIFICATIONS** - Pursuing a degree in Business, Industrial/Organizational Psychology, Organizational Development, Human Resources Management, or other related degrees - This internship is from June to August and is 40 hours per week/or 20 hours per week depending on school schedule in a virtual setting - Must be enrolled fulltime at an accredited college or university during internship - Students must be authorized to work in the U.S. without future visa sponsorship requirements _ANTHEM, INC. HAS BEEN NAMED AS A FORTUNE 100 BEST COMPANIES TO WORK FOR®, IS RANKED AS ONE OF THE 2020 WORLD’S MOST ADMIRED COMPANIES AMONG HEALTH INSURERS BY FORTUNE MAGAZINE, AND A 2020 AMERICA’S BEST EMPLOYERS FOR DIVERSITY BY FORBES. TO LEARN MORE ABOUT OUR COMPANY AND APPLY, PLEASE VISIT US AT CAREERS.ANTHEMINC.COM. AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER/DISABILITY/VETERAN. ANTHEM PROMOTES THE DELIVERY OF SERVICES IN A CULTURALLY COMPETENT MANNER AND CONSIDERS CULTURAL COMPETENCY WHEN EVALUATING APPLICANTS FOR ALL ANTHEM POSITIONS._

For this position, you would be writing with the chance to do podcasts and videos on a consistent basis. During this internship, we will help you to learn about journalism and what it takes to make it in today's journalistic world.
The program will run for a predetermined amount of time. Normally we go for either a summer or semester. But a student can join in the middle of a semester and go until decided upon.
We have been approved by many colleges for internship credit so please make sure to ask your school if brought on. Internship credit is not a requirement for this internship.
You can cover your favorite team or a team that is available, writing about anything and everything that goes on with them. You are welcome to try on full-on beat writing if you should choose to but it is not a requirement. Or you can write about the game as a whole.

Job Description: We are looking for a mission driven individual who believes in increasing civic engagement and youth activism. The intern should have experience in graphic design including with programs in the Adobe suite. The graphic design intern will work remotely with our social media director and app designers/developers to produce original graphic designs. The intern will report to our social media director. 

The intern will be working in a collaborative environment. Interns will learn about progressive organizing, start-ups, partnerships, marketing, and about the non-profit, civic technology and progressive space.

This is an unpaid internship.

As a grants department intern you may be responsible for:

Working on grant projects as both an individual and member of a project team.
Research and identify available government and private funding opportunities.
Maintain knowledge of proper protocols and all relevant local, federal, and state guidelines required for the proper proposal submission process.
Generate proposals and all required supporting documents in response to solicitations.
Generate revenues for foundation programs and services through submission of researched, well- written, and well-documented fund-raising proposals.

Contribute to and maintain funding calendar activities.
Maintain communication on progress of obtained grants with departmental and project managers.

BEGIN YOUR PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AS AN INTERN WITH NORTHWESTERN MUTUAL 

One of America’s Top 15 internships according to Vault.com, Northwestern Mutual Financial Representative interns strive to understand their clients' goals and visions to uncover financial solutions that put them on a path to achieve their financial objectives. 

Our Financial Representative interns come from varying academic backgrounds and experiences to build rewarding practices and relationships with our clients. As you excel in your internship, you will be supported by our network of specialists, training programs, and mentoring opportunities to help your clients and to build your practice.

THE OPPORTUNITY: 

- Representatives help clients to achieve and maintain financial security by providing financial advice and matching solutions with clients’ needs and goals.

- Develop rapport with clients and foster long-term relationships.

- Be knowledgeable about Northwestern Mutual financial products and financial market trends. 

- Build and maintain client bases, keep current client financial plans up-to-date, and build a portfolio of new clients on an ongoing basis.

- Provide dedicated and focused client experiences. 

BY JOINING OUR TEAM, YOU'LL HAVE ACCESS TO:

- An award-winning training program to help you get started.

- Mentorship and professional development training throughout your entire career. 

- A culture that promotes diversity, teamwork, work/life balance, recognition, and rewards.

- The opportunity to design your roadmap to leadership and specialized roles.

- Leading industry products and solutions built on an integrated technology platform.

- Financial support for professional designations and certifications, such as the CFP® certification or Series 6 & 63 licenses, which will boost your career from Financial Representative intern to Financial Advisor. 

- A rewarding career, with extraordinary income potential and a variable compensation model, including recognition and bonuses, where hard work directly relates to your sales results. 

https://www.northwesternmutual.com/internships/

WHO WE ARE:

At Northwestern Mutual, we believe that everyone deserves to “spend their lives living” and that a strong financial plan is the cornerstone for ensuring that reality! Financial security is not just something that happens in retirement but is what enables our clients to spend their lives living!

Our teams of financial advisors across the nation embody these beliefs and are committed to helping clients reach their financial goals. With over 70% of American’s citing that their financial planning needs improvement, a career with Northwestern Mutual provides abundant opportunities to serve this growing need!

Recognized by FORTUNE as one of the "World's Most Admired" companies, Northwestern Mutual has been among the leaders in the financial services industry for nearly 160 years and has a proven track record of financial success. 

Northwestern Mutual is the marketing name for The Northwestern Mutual Life Insurance Company (NM), Milwaukee, WI and its subsidiaries. Financial representatives are independent contractors. Certified Financial Planner Board of Standards Inc. owns the certification marks CFP®, CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNERTM and CFP® (with flame design) in the U.S., which it awards to individuals who successfully complete CFP Board's initial and ongoing certification requirements.

MTA Visions seeks a Project Manager Intern (Government Relations) that is interested in global public policy, politics, and government relations from a local, state, national, and international lens to support the delivery of the firms' exploratory global impact projects through: sourcing current events, drafting impact/policy business development briefs, converting written briefs into video briefs, conducting global research on 4 assigned projects in 7 countries of choice, and managing and creating assets for public relations campaign for each project via popular social media platforms such as Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, and Youtube. This experience is limited to interns that are interested in engaging in a robust professional development program that is designed to providing aspiring corporate social responsibility and/or government relations CONSULTANTS with the knowledge, skills, and mentorship necessary to join a global consulting firm in a mid-level position.

The Game Haus is a sports and esports media startup company. We are based in Cincinnati, Ohio but we are fully online currently which means that you can work from the comfort of home. However, we are an unpaid internship. Our company is on the cutting edge of journalism as we help to blaze the trail for new journalists in both fields.
Our main philosophy is: Sports=Esports. Equal coverage of both is important and that means having respect for both.
For this position, you would be mostly writing on a consistent basis. During this internship, we will help you to learn about journalism and what it takes to make it in today's journalistic world.
The program will run for a predetermined amount of time based on what you discuss with us, the dates above are mostly for a start date. Normally we go for a semester.
We have been approved by many colleges for internship credit so please make sure to ask your school if brought on. Internship credit is not a requirement for this internship.
We are currently looking for people to write about specific teams.

iPlay® provides FREE instrument rentals and virtual instruction to students during this pandemic enhance their learning aptitude as well as release stress and anxiety during COVID. This program is offered to all students throughout the United States from New Jersey to Florida – to California, as the virtual platform allows us to extend our reach free of cost. We place a strong emphasis on minorities and underserved communities where introduction to an instrument is very unlikely. We rent and provide the instruments to the students FREE of charge. We are preparing our second semester to begin in September. 

We are looking for music instructors to provide virtual classroom lessons for the following instruments (you may apply to one or more position):

Stringed guitar
Violin
Flute
Clarinet
Saxophone
Piano (keyboard)
Drums
Vocal

Interns will create a curriculum to introduce first-time instrument users to their selected choice. Virtual classroom sizes should average no more than 10-12 students per class. Courses tentatively will run from September, 2021 to December, 2021.

position: FELLOW, Foreign Affairs and Global Diplomacy
description:
MTA Visions seeks a Foreign Affairs and Global Diplomacy (FAGD) Fellow with a strong business acumen and interest in foreign affairs from a consulting perspective to contribute to its Inclusive Diplomacy global programs and services under MTA Visions' Management, Corporate Social Responsibility, and Government Relations business units. The role will allow a motivated student with strong foreign affairs, diplomacy, customer service, management and/or business development experience to deepen their understanding of Foreign Affairs and Global Diplomacy in the global client life cycle context while building skills and gaining experience as a writer, researcher, project manager, and valued team member.

The ideal candidate has a passion for management, sales, marketing, research, and communicating global solutions to global issues within both Foreign Policy and Diplomacy context to prospective clients. This candidate seeks an opportunity to build their knowledge, skill, and ability around the components of a successful Foreign Policy and Diplomacy client engagement and management strategy for a global mission-driven consulting firm.

The Foreign Affairs and Global Diplomacy Fellow will report to the Staff and Communications Coordinator and may be entrusted with management duties to mentor selected interns.

Job Description:

This Sports Media, Inc. internship program is designed to take you step-by-step through the techniques and skills you will employ in your new career as an accounting research expert. Learning covers research project manager, database management, data mining and accounting disciplines, Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Learn media accounting, event budgets, inventory, and reporting, forecasting, along with marketing data. Work with several departments to forecast budgets and sales for events, catering, digital out of home media, sports marketing, golf outings and fundraisers. This will be a remote work position, interns can check in between Sept. 7-20 for Fall 2021.

Responsibilities: 

Assist in managing accounting software in excel and collaborating in google sheets.
Projects will include, but are not limited to a database work where the value of products offered in each venue will be calculated for potential profit, forecasting, and media value.  
Assist in management, research, and communication of database construction.
Maintain LinkedIn network presence.
Analyzing assets, liabilities, and advertising accounting within projects.
Create projections for crowd funding and start engines for new product launches.
Analyzing costs associated with media planning and buying.

description: ABOUT LUMEN Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies. THE ROLE LUMEN’S INTERNSHIP PROGRAM IS A PATH FOR CAREER READINESS IN THE 4TH INDUSTRIAL REVOLUTION. Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology.  During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time.  Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace.   THE EXPERIENCE - INNOVATE – to deliver solutions to real business problems - TRANSFORM – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects - CONNECT – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. - IMPACT – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.   JOB DESCRIPTION As a Finance Intern in our Strategic Enterprise & Public Sector organization, the Intern will work collaboratively with our sales and compensation team and help to administer the sale quota for the company, as well as help to manage and maintain compensation during the plan year and stand up the Anaplan system.   MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES: - Research and evaluate current/open issues for the sales teams through the dispute process - Examine monthly, quarterly, and annual sales quotas to ensure accuracy - Assist in the development of sales quotas and forecasts for the sales team   WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS - Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, rising senior or master’s level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – June 2023. - Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Economics, Finance, Accounting or related degree. PROFICIENCY AND UNDERSTANDING OF; - Understanding of sales analysis is preferred - Strong research and data analysis skills - Proficiency in Microsoft Office and CRM software and Systems - Projection and forecasting skills preferred PROFESSIONAL ATTRIBUTES  - Strong drive for results and taking initiative - Ability to be resourceful and adaptable - Strong written and verbal communication skills - Ability to work independently and with cross-functional teams - Flexible and adapts well to change WORK SETTING - Remote/ Work From Home. - Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June – August) - Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations) - US work authorization   WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you! We do not tolerate unlawful discrimination in any employment decisions, including recruiting, hiring, compensation, promotion, benefits, discipline, termination, job assignments or training.
