It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.  Job duties and responsibilities are subject to change based on changing business needs and conditions.

position: [REMOTE OR DC AREA] Winter Political Campaign Internship
description:
Winter Political Campaign Internship

Hans Riemer for Montgomery County Executive is looking for remote and in-person interns for a competitive 2022 primary election. Applicants from college, high school, and more are encouraged to apply! This “Winternship” will run from December 15th through January 31st. (While applicants are strongly encouraged to apply before December 15th, we will accept applications through December 29th.)

Interns will have the opportunity to learn the ins and outs of a modern progressive campaign. Prospective applicants will be placed in one of six departments: Social Media & Communications, Graphics, Organizing, Research & Policy, Finance & Political, or Direct Voter Contact. Previous experience is not required for most departments and interns will be taught the fundamentals of their department. Because this is a more intensive program, you’ll be fully integrated with our core senior leadership team.

If you are looking to expand your resume during the winter break, this is a great way to learn how an actual campaign runs, gain the basic skills needed to be an effective political organizer and strategist, and build your professional network.

In case you are wondering what a County Executive is:  it is a pretty big deal. The County Executive serves a similar role to a Mayor in a city, or a Governor in a state.  Located just outside of DC, Montgomery County has over 1 million residents [more than a congressional district] and is an influential local government nation-wide. Montgomery County is also home to a number of federal institutions (NIH, FDA, NIST, NOAA). Because of the structure of Maryland’s government, the Montgomery County Executive is one of the most important County-level officers in the whole United States.

Responsibilities could include (depending on department placement):

Communicate with voters and assist with call time and engagement events
Assist department heads and senior staff with needs as they arise
Spearhead political organizing program among other students in your community
Organize grassroots volunteers across the district
Manage donor lists and engage with prospective donors
Assist the call time manager and the candidate in fundraising prep
Social media content creation and idea development
Compile press clippings and relevant stories

Requirements:

A full-time weekly time commitment of 30+ hours
Completing a minimum of two voter contact shifts per week
If applicable, we will work with your institution to provide school credit for this internship

To Apply: Click on the following link, https://forms.gle/9j8nU4MbitgewxGh8. Please submit any questions to david@hansriemer.com

About Hans:

Hans is a progressive At-large Member of the Montgomery County Council who is running for MoCo County Executive. Growing up in Oakland, California, Hans learned from an early age that progressive social change is necessary for disadvantaged communities to make progress, and has dedicated his career to that cause since. 

Hans understands the crucial role that young people play in politics and wants to ensure Democrats are training the next generation of political activists and leaders. After college, Hans started the 2030 Center, a policy activism organization focused on young people and the fight against Geroge Bush’s efforts to privatize the social safety net. Then he worked with Rock the Vote to register nearly a million young voters during the 2004 election, and then went on to join the Obama campaign in 2007 as the National Youth Director. In short, Hans is an organizer at heart and this campaign is looking for people who will join the campaign in that spirit — all politics is local!

We are an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religious creed, national origin, non-disqualifying handicap, veteran status, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, or upon any other unlawful basis.

Job Information Regions Hospital Nurse Intern in St Paul, Minnesota Nurse Intern * Job ID: 61048 * Department: Various Departments * City: St Paul, MN * Location: RH - Regions Hospital & Clinics * Position Type: Temporary Part-Time * Anticipated Work Schedule: .8 N * Shift: Night * Hrs/Pay Period: 64 Email a Friend Apply Now Job Description: Regions Hospital is looking for exceptional, patient focused nursing students to join our team as a winter nurse intern to make a difference for our patients and our community. This position will start on December 13th, 2021 and continue through February 2nd, 2022. This intern position is for students who are December 2021 or Spring 2022 RN graduates. We are known for saving lives in our Level I Trauma Center, and our nursing staff are key to the exceptional care we provide each patient. Our Professional Nursing Practice Model offers patient and family-centered care that maintains an unwavering focus on what matters most: caring and healing at the patients bedside. Our award-winning programs give our patients and their families a place of comfort and healing. We are proud of the care we give each and every patient. At Regions Hospital youll find a warm, diverse group of people who are committed to helping our patients and each other. We foster an inclusive environment that encourages new ways of thinking, celebrates differences and recognizes hard work. Were also committed to living our values. This means you can expect us to be your partner and treat you with dignity and respect. Join our team and make good happen! POSITION SUMMARY STATEMENT: Provides inpatient care by performing both non-professional nursing care duties as well as professional nursing duties that are delegated and supervised by a professional nurse and are within the scope of the job description and performs other duties as assigned. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Education: Current enrollment in a BSN or BAN program and has completed year 3 (of a baccalaureate program). Must be a December 2021 or Spring 2022 graduate. Must enroll in and provide proof of enrollment in an internship course at your school. Experience: Clinical student nursing experience under the direction of a nursing faculty member. Licensure/ Registration/ Certification: Must obtain CPR certification prior to start of internship. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: * Knowledge and skill in performing aseptic technique. * Ability to follow written and verbal instructions. * Ability to properly lift 50 pounds, lifts 100 pounds with assistance. * Ability to stand and walk for prolonged periods of time. * Ability to communicate effectively and work cooperatively with patients, visitors, and co-workers. * Ability to perform basic technical nursing skills. * Ability to incorporate the nursing process when providing patient care. Additional Information: We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Your Opportunity Do you want to spend your summer internship with a company that has been challenging the conventions of the financial services industry for over 45 years? Schwab's mission is to help our clients create a better future for themselves, their families, and their communities. It is summed up in our tagline - Own your tomorrow - and it permeates everything we do. The design of the program invites interns to engage directly in Schwab's culture of service, while challenging them with a blend of learning programs, team-building activities, networking opportunities, and enriching work projects. Features of our 2022 program include: Business Track Project : Working with your host business track at Schwab provides a relevant and valuable experience to translate classroom learning into real business projects. Intern Cohort Project : Partner with other interns to brainstorm, discuss learning experiences, and present solutions. Learning Activities : Participate in facilitated training, team discussions and events, individual assessments and activities, senior leader meetings, and on-the-job training. Committed Intern Leader: Receive regular feedback from your leader, participate in career-related discussions, and provide your own feedback. Strengths Application: Learn about yourself and how to apply your unique strengths, abilities, and goals to the work you do as part of Schwab's strengths-based' culture. Networking: Build your network by interacting with professionals across Schwab, including senior leaders, peers, and Schwab Intern Academy Alumni. Because interns are considered a primary pipeline for full-time opportunities, every intern candidate must be eligible for full-time employment upon graduation and must also meet the following requirements: Enrolled in a current undergraduate or graduate program tracking to graduate between December 2022 and May/June 2023 Ability to work full time and be on-site at assigned Schwab location during the 9-week program ( June 6 to August 5, 2022 ) Have specific skills as specified by the hosting Business Track Schwab is recognized as an industry leader, and our inviting culture will accept your individuality and partner you with other like-minded and solution-focused students. We will invest in your summer experience by providing you direction and leadership for a robust and well-rounded internship, as well as helping you focus on a potential future career with Schwab. Regardless of which opportunity you pursue, we will provide you with a consistent and outstanding experience - one you won't soon forget! What you are good at Optimism and curiosity, who possess a keen sense of purpose, awareness, and knowledge and who have the demeanor of an everyday leader Resourcefulness and flexibility, who enjoy working through cross-functional partnerships and collaboration to achieve a common purpose An innovative and questioning demeanor, who constantly look for better ways to do things, have a passion for service, and seek to exceed client expectations What you have A strong desire to build and grow a career in the financial services industry Outstanding communication skills (written and oral) The courage to ask why As an affirmative action employer, Schwab takes affirmative action to employ qualified minorities, women, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans in our intern program. As a culture that values Diversity and Inclusion, Schwab encourages the application of Women, Minorities, Individuals with Disabilities and Protected Veterans to the Intern Academy. There are many different business tracks that you can engage with over the course of the summer. Some of the tracks that will host 2022 interns are: Corporate Risk Management Digital Services Finance Front Line Risk Management Human Resources Internal Audit Investor and Client Service Marketing Model Risk Management Operations Retirement Business Services Schwab Asset Management Solutions Schwab Branch Network Schwab Technology Services Workplace Financial Services Operations Intern Innovated. Strategic. Efficient. and always good stewards for our clients and business groups. These qualities are what make Operational Services a core enabler of Schwab's vision to be the most trusted leader in investment services and ensure Schwab remains a good steward of shareholder value. We are focused on providing great service to our clients and the client-facing organizations within Schwab, as well as safeguarding assets. Whether it's processing corporate actions, performing trade orders reviews, assisting with estate planning, or answering hotline calls. We work behind the scenes to deliver on Schwab's purpose. Operations play a critical role in helping our clients achieve their financial goals and inspiring client loyalty. You will engage in dialogue to reduce client effort and improve the overall client experience. You will spend time in operations to understand common client problems and help find innovative solutions for our client base. You may work with Platform Strategy to define client experience and operational requirements. You may work with Business Analysts to define process requirements. What You're Good At: Positive attitude, enthusiasm, professionalism, and strong work ethic with high level of integrity and ethics. Superior communication skills both written and verbal Excellent analytical skills and ability to multi-task to perform multiple complex tasks with a superior level of attention to detail. Collaborative and relational work style Technical skills with the ability to utilize at least 5 different applications at any one time, including Windows, internet researching, database systems, and email. Effective relationship builderability to partner cross-functionally, cross-enterprise and work effectively with various levels of the organization as well as various personality types. What You Will Learn: You will gain a unique blend of balancing operational efficiency and risk mitigation, a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. You will learn how to analyze and understand sophisticated business problems that are part of operating in the financial industry. You will learn to work collaboratively with other team members to deliver high quality outcomes. What You Will Have: Anticipation of graduating with a Bachelor's Degree in Dec. 2022 or May/June 2023 An ability to work Monday-Friday, between the dates of June 6th and August 5th A passion for learning about the Financial Services Industry and helping investors with their wealth management needs Own Your Tomorrow embodies everything we do! We are committed to helping our employees ignite their potential and achieve their dreams. Our employees get to play a central role in reinventing a multi-trillion-dollar industry, creating a better, more modern way to build and manage wealth. Benefits: A competitive and flexible package designed to empower you for today and tomorrow. We offer a competitive and flexible package designed to help you make the most of your life at work and at hometoday and in the future. Explore further. Schwab is committed to building a diverse and expansive workplace where everyone feels valued. ABOUT LUMEN Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. THE ROLE LUMEN’S INTERNSHIP PROGRAM IS A PATH FOR CAREER READINESS IN THE 4TH INDUSTRIAL REVOLUTION.  Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology.  During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time.  Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. The Experience  •    Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems  •    Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects •    Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. •    Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves. THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES As an IT Analyst in our Strategic Planning and Transformation organization, you will be a part of the Vendor Management Organization and Software Asset Management team who manages all software purchases and renewals for all software within Strategic Planning and Transformation. The team is also responsible for managing unused software and managing software use against our contractual rights across Strategic Planning and Transformation. The intern candidate for this role should be excited about learning, analytics, and collaborating with a team. You will assist with entries in our software asset management tool and collect software usage data and compare it to our contract license entitlements.   WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE - Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, rising senior or master’s level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – May 2023. - Education/Degree: In pursuit of degree in a Business or Technical degree field is preferred. - Position will be located in Broomfield, CO or Remote  - Proficiency and understanding of;  -    Business Analytics -    Excel and MS Office -    MS Teams - Familiarity with software and basic licensing terms, or interest in learning -    Strong drive for results and taking initiative -    Ability to be resourceful and adaptable -    Ability to collaborate and be agile -    Strong written and verbal communication skills -    Ability to interact with business partners and drive the conversation. -    Flexible and adapts well to change -    US work authorization  - Work Setting -    Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Broomfield -CO, Littleton-CO or Remote  -    Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June – August) -    Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations) -    US work authorization  WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you! Our 11-week paid internship program gives interns hands-on experience working with various groups across multiple office locations within Comcast Technology Solutions. Do you have that passion for video, audio and graphics creation? Do you love music? Ever wanted to produce, edit and mix segments for television/radio/podcast? This internship is ideal for those seeking employment in the Entertainment Post-Production field.

American Weekend Entertainment (https://www.aweinc.tv) is looking for 2 dedicated individuals to help create daily and weekly video content for our website and mobile app. Skills in video editing (Final Cut, Avid, Premiere), graphics creation (photoshop/illustrator), audio editing and mixing (Pro Tools, Logic, Audition) are necessary. Are you passionate about working for a company with an unparalleled commitment to diversity, sustainability and our communities? Dell Technologies Services (DT Services) is an organization within Dell Technologies. DT Services provides support and extended warranty services, managed deployment, enterprise installation, and configuration services for both Enterprise and Client customers. It is one of the most strategic and profitable organizations in the company and is currently experiencing explosive global growth.  DT Services is made up of global operations teams to include customer service, supply chain, and professional services; marketing and sales operations teams, finance, engineering, and more.   **What you’ll achieve** Global Process Engineering team is seeking a creative problem solver with a strong delivery solution design mindset. You will be responsible for designing solutions that will effectively drive strategic technology transformation and business optimization priorities for Dell EMC support and deployment services. You will be performing current state versus desired state gap assessment by conducting system & material flow studies and cross-functioning multi-stakeholder discussions. You will work with cross functional business stakeholders and learns to manage E2E program scopes. **You will** - Focus on next generation designs that enable delivery across strategic focus areas such as cloud and managed services - Learn and deliver in the respective program scope domain – Go To Market (Sales/offers), Deployment, Support, Supply Chain - Transformation requirements gathering and driving process improvements from conception through implementation - Drive strong financial and cost-based business outcome assessments - Conduct reviews and readouts with Executive audience - Analyze, recommend, and implement enhancements to existing work methods, flows, and processes to optimize profitability and improve customer experience - Work effectively with cross-functional partners to ensure collaborative solutions to meet business requirements - Implement improvements by coordinating the activities of vendors, internal resources, and internal customers

Job Description: The Claims Apprentice Program is an exciting opportunity for recent college graduates interested in a career as a Claims Adjuster in the Property amp; Casualty insurance industry. As a Claims Apprentice, you will be trained by PMA's team of claims experts and leaders. Over the course of the program, you will develop your skills and knowledge in the area of workers' compensation and assume a caseload of claimsof increasing complexity. Job Responsibilities: * Promptly investigate assigned claims. Determine coverage, compensability, potential for subrogation recovery, and second injury fund (when applicable). * Ensure timely denial or payment of benefits in accordance with jurisdictional requirements. * Within granted authority, establish appropriate reserves with documented rationale, maintain and adjust reserves over the life of the claim to reflect changes in exposure. Negotiate claims settlements within granted authority. * Establish and implement appropriate action plans for case resolution including medical and disability management, litigation management, negotiation and disposition. * Work collaboratively with PMA nurse professionals to develop and execute return to work strategies. * Maintain a working knowledge of jurisdictional requirements and applicable case law for each state serviced. * Communicate effectively with internal and external parties on a wide variety of claims and account issues. * Authorize treatment based on the practiced protocols established by statute or the PMA Managed Care department. * Assist PMA clients by suggesting panel provider information in accordance with applicable state statutes. * Demonstrate commitment to Company's Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, and apply knowledge of compliance policies and procedures, standards and laws applicable to job responsibilities in the performance of work. Requirements: Qualifications: * Bachelor's degree. * 1-3 years of work and/or volunteer experience in a service-oriented setting. * Leadership ability as demonstrated through participation in extra-curricular activities. * Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills. * Ability to work independently. * Strong critical thinking skills that demonstrate analysis, judgment and sound decision making. * Excellent verbal and written communication skills. * Excellent customer service skills.

About the Position

The American Heart Association has an excellent opportunity for a Graphic Design Internship in our Event Services department. This position can be remote/home based. Ideally, the intern will be based in the Southeast region (Florida, Georgia, Tennessee, North Carolina, South Carolina, Alabama, Mississippi, Louisiana, Puerto Rico).

In this role, you will design materials to be used to advertise/market the Southeast’s fundraising & community events and also for day-of event materials. You will develop on-brand, and on-strategy marketing pieces. This person will work with the Design Specialist and support the Development team.

Essential Job Duties

You will utilize InDesign, Illustrator, PDF Editor, Canva and Salesforce to create digital and print-ready designs.
You will look at a design concept/theme and create a matching suite of collateral pieces. For example, taking a pre-made event theme and producing the matching Save-The-Date, Invitation, PowerPoint, Video, Social Media Post, Zoom Background, Letterhead, Program, Email Header & Footer image, Outlook Email template, Facebook Cover Image, 24x36 Signage, ROI Booklet, Yard Signs, etc.
You will ensure consistency of brand and creative across all produced materials.
You will use Microsoft Teams and Outlook to communicate with your supervisor.
Other projects as needed.

Learning Opportunities:

How to produce designs within a corporation’s branding guidelines.
Guidance on creating different collateral pieces used in event marketing and production.
Gain experience working as an internal graphic designer within a corporation.
Become proficient with using Canva software to design materials.

An intern's main responsibility would be to creatively and effectively help build brand and client base in various markets. Initiatives include bolstering our speed reading program, anxiety relief coaching, and tests, including, SSAT, SAT, GMAT, GRE LSAT, MCAT and our MCAT CARS training. You'd support our communications with affiliates, partners, schools, allied professionals, and groups who would be interested in our services and products. You'd also be in touch with various professionals who also work in our sector.

We're just transformed signature course is MindFlow: a one-day/5 hour class into an online platform https://mindflowspeedreading.com. This course is hugely effective for speed reading on high stakes standardized tests. It's a great feeder for our one-on-one tutoring (see: Mindflowclass.com/mindflow). 

To this end you will help with: 

Develop and maintain collaboration with agencies
Update resources for referrals to colleagues and resources. 
Gather and compile necessary client information and perform data entry into data tracking and evaluation systems. 
Perform outreach and marketing to colleagues and potential clients informing them of our services provided. 
Business assessment; access to capital; business planning; marketing; financial projections; and initiating relationships to outside agencies for specialized collaborations. 
Follow up with alumni and current clients on an on-going basis to track impact of services provided. 
Prepare, coordinate and facilitate business-related projects and initiatives. 
Engage in special projects and initiatives. 

*This internship will also allow flexibility for tele-commuting. 

In addition to applying here, please send your information to bara@citytestprep.com.

position: Online Health Fitness Revolution Magazine Internship
description:
Health Fitness Revolution magazine is one of the fastest growing health and fitness magazine in America founded by 4 x #1 Fitness trainer in the world, HarperCollins published author of “ReSync Your Life”, and official “Fitness Czar” of the City of Houston, Samir Becic, as proclaimed by Mayor Sylvester Turner.

﻿Samir is known worldwide as a serious health and fitness expert who is bringing fitness into every segment of society- from economy, education, and spirituality, all the way to politics and national security. Health Fitness Revolution created the first lists in the world of the fittest politicians, spiritual leaders, billionaires… our lists have been published in tens of thousands of media outlets across the globe.

We are looking for dynamic, energetic, visionary interns who will help us grow and make a worldwide impact. 

We are specifically looking for an intern to help research, write, and curate our online magazine resource www.healthfitnessrevolution.com which recently hit over 14 million readers and our social media.

Interns will receive hands-on experience with every aspect of the company, in addition to understanding the ins and outs of running a start-up online media health platform. Responsibilities will vary on a daily basis but will include managing an electronic magazine, social media, research, and writing. Interns will also be given the opportunity to participate in the programs HFR offers, by interacting with different members of the community and in the industry.

Unpaid, working closely with editor and founder, 12-30 hours a week (flexible)

Job Title Investments Intern, AIP Location Ameritas Investment Partners-NELK1 Area of Interest Investments Full-Time/Part Time Part-time Job Description Discover and work with various teams inside Ameritas Investment Partners! At Ameritas, fulfilling life is what we do daily. We continuously strive to help our customers and employees enjoy life at its very best by reducing uncertainty, helping grow assets and protecting what is most cherished. We're here to help people put worry behind and the future ahead and help enable a life that's rich in family, happiness, health and financial security. When lives are fulfilled, our mission is fulfilled. Ameritas Investments Partners is hiring for an Investments Intern to drive the business by working with various investment management teams including Fixed Income, Equities, Commercial Mortgage Loans, Real Estate, Alternative Investments and Wealth Management. Ameritas Investment Partners is a registered investment advisor managing more than $17 billion in assets under management for insurance companies, public and private pension funds, endowments, foundations, mutual funds and high net worth individuals. What you do Work alongside the Fixed Income research team, gaining a broad understanding of credit analysis and trading within the fixed income markets. Work alongside the equity team providing support for a variety of equity and alternative asset classes. Work with the Wealth Management team to gain exposure to the investment management process for private client portfolios. What you bring Able to fulfill a year-round internship working 15-20 hours in the academic year and 40 hours in the summer. Position will go from May 2022 and will end in May 2023 Minimum Education Requirements: * Major in Finance, Accounting, Economics or Business Administration * Must be enrolled in a college program during internship program * Excellent verbal and written communication skills * Skilled in Microsoft Word and Excel * Strong analytical and problem solving skills * Highly organized and detail oriented * Ability to work well in a team environment * Self-motivated We are Ameritas: proud to say we're in the business of fulfilling life Company Video CLICK HERE to watch a company video

Copywriter 2021 Intern

Must be currently enrolled in an accredited academic degree program to apply.

To apply, include the following: 1) A cover letter; 2) Your resume; 3) A link to your portfolio or attached samples.

This is an unpaid internship with the opportunity to earn class credits and a participation stipend at the end of the program.

Are you the type of person who is always looking for the next big thing in the food and beverage space? Do you love storytelling and supporting the diverse and underrepresented voices of the culinary industry?

Do you love bringing your words to life with creativity and finding your own solutions to all sorts of challenges and problems within a company as it relates to the messaging?

If you’d love to apply that passion for writing in a creative, practical, and meaningful internship with a progressive company that values its customers, employees, and local communities, then we have an amazing opportunity for you.

Copywriter Intern 2021

In this dynamic position, you will lend your expertise in blogging, marketing and sales copywriting to a range of written mediums relating to the food and beverage industry and the creative career/brands launched by minority and underrepresented culinary professionals.

Your writing skills live outside of the box and you enjoy bringing culture alive through your written work. Your skills bring brands alive and tells a story through your written words. Your words have power, influence, and draped with diverse textures and speak to the liveliness and energetic force of the food and beverage industry.

We are seeking someone who brings passion to their work, attentional to detail, a keen eye, and a creative flair to every project and task.

In terms of making an impact at Flavors, your written words will bring life to Flavors’ brand from day one: not fetching coffees- we get our own coffee!

We are always looking for new opportunities to improve our brand copy, so in addition to blogging, marketing, and sales copywriting, you’ll be spending some of your time doing research and making real contributions to our business to help us continue to grow so that we can make a bigger impact throughout Prince George’s County and our culinary member tenants.

There is going to be plenty to keep you busy and learning.

You will thrive in this role if you are:

• Growth focused – you ask great questions to understand the team’s goals, you seek out more responsibility, and you back it up with excellent execution based on the project mission.

• Self-Motivated – you are not sitting back waiting for work- you are proactive in supporting your team members and when you hit a snag in your work, you bring thought provoking questions and ideas of possible next steps/alternatives to the team you are working with.

• Organized – you always have a good idea of what needs to be done and manage your workload to ensure timely delivery. You thrive under tight deadlines and are a great multi-tasker.

We are looking for someone with more than just writing know-how: we want someone who is ready to take on new challenges and is willing to learn and apply a brand-new set of skills and knowledge.

But you will not be alone: we have got an amazing team, and you will need to be a great team player to take full advantage of everything they have to offer.

The Details

This is a remote position. Preference is given to those residing or attending school in the Washington, DC region. You will be required to join video calls for meetings, training, and project updates. The length of your internship is 12 weeks and will begin 12/1/2021 and the hours/days you work are flexible to fit your school schedule with an expectation 5-10 hours per week. Our company work hours are Monday-Friday 8am-5pm and Saturday 9am-2pm (on occasion and for special projects).

Everyone knows that internships are a great way to make contacts and learn important job skills. But at Flavors, you’ll also be getting to work with an amazing and positive team who’s making a difference within commercial real estate and serving our food and beverage entrepreneur tenants, which include private chefs, bakers, caterers, food truck owners, bartenders, food and beverage event planners and hospitality educators.

Ask our team what it is like to work here and they will also tell you we have fun together. We celebrate everyone’s birthday, plan team-building events (virtually due to COVID) and support each other however we can: working at Flavors is an opportunity that everyone can enjoy and be truly proud of.

G.R.O.W. is looking for an experienced business development professional to support the succession of our Executive Director. Drive all succession planning strategies for GROW’s Executive Director role
Work closely with GROW’s leadership to define competencies and candidate profile required to undertake key responsibilities
Ensure the execution of an evolving strategy, guide research and out of the box thinking to inform strategic direction
Create and execute recruitment efforts with the HR Manager, including conducting outreach and identifying potential talent pools for candidates
Equitably assess candidates against role criteria based on current and future organization objectives; develop training and procedures to ensure the current skills remain within the organization
Create a funding model and build out a team, with HR Manager, to support fundraising efforts to secure funds for filling the Executive Director position
Develop a holistic understanding of GROW’s mission and initiatives to identify and plan for further growth opportunities

**We are the bank of the innovation economy.** When you work with the world's most innovative companies, you know you're making a difference. Our clients are the game changers, leaders and investors who fuel the global innovation economy. They're the businesses behind the next medical breakthroughs. And the visionaries whose new technologies could transform the way people live and work. They come to SVB for our expertise, deep network and nearly forty years of experience in the industries we serve, and to partner with diverse teams of passionate, enterprising SVBers, dedicated to an inclusive approach to helping them grow and succeed at every stage of their business. Join us at SVB and be part of bringing our clients' world-changing ideas to life. At SVB, we have the opportunity to grow and collectively make an impact by supporting the innovative clients and communities SVB serves. We pride ourselves in having both a diverse client roster and an equally diverse and inclusive organization. And we work diligently to encourage all with different ways of thinking, different ways of working, and especially those traditionally underrepresented in technology and financial services, to apply. Silicon Valley Bank is the most sought-after financial partner in the global innovation economy. We bring together entrepreneurs, investors, ventures capitalists, and private equity firms to move their bold ideas forward, fast. Our clients define what comes next. In the past 35 years, we have accumulated more experience with start-ups and high-growth tech than any other company in the world. In fact, a majority of the most compelling Fintech disruptors bank with us. Our clients include: Beyond Meat, Shopify, HelloFresh, Cloudera, and Andreessen Horowitz, just to name a few. More than half of the innovation companies that completed an IPO in the last two years were SVB clients. **Move your career forward, fast.** If you’re looking for a company that values your ambition and passion — and your health and happiness outside of work — you’re in the right place. We’re looking for the next generation of leaders to join our **Summer 2022 Internship Program** at SVB. We offer real-world, hands-on experiences for college students and will help put you on the right track towards building a career with purpose. Are you excited about what’s next? Drop your resume today and let us know that you’re interested in joining our Summer Internship Program!

Job Information Lumen Intern - Technical Writer - Summer 2022 - Remote Work in St. Paul, Minnesota About Lumen Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumens network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies. The Role Lumens Internship Program is a path for career readiness in the 4th Industrial Revolution. Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology. During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time. Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. The Experience Innovate to deliver solutions to real business problems Transform your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects Connect to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. Impact through Community & Social Involvement collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves. The Main Responsibilities As a Technical Writing Intern in our Strategic Planning and Transformation organization, the Intern would help gather, create, and catalog documentation supporting Project Managers. Tasks during the 10 weeks will include developing documentation, communicating with team members, and organizing documentation. The ideal intern will have Technical writing skills with common languages in the industry. Project management experience or exposure Excellent writing skills Technical writing experience Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, familiarity with Teams What We Look For in a Candidate Education Requirements * Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, rising senior or masters level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 May 2023. * Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in English, Tech, Communications, or similar degree field. * Proficiency and understanding of; * General understanding of IT infrastructure principles * Concepts of Project Management * Windows, Lunix, Unix servers * Oracle, SQL, MySQL, Informix databases * IT acronyms (LAN, WAN, OS, DB, HW) Professional Attributes * Strong drive for results and taking initiative * Ability to be resourceful and adaptable * Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions * Strong written and verbal communication skills * Ability to interact with business partners and drive the conversation. * Flexible and adapts well to change * Excellent organizational skills Work Setting * Remote work from home * US work authorization What to Expect Next After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position. A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application. For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application. Thank you! position: Forestry Technician - U.S. Military Veterans Only
description:
U.S. Military Veterans! Do you love working in the outdoors? Are you ready to start a career with the U.S. Forest Service? Keep reading to learn more about this great veteran-only (paid) internship opportunity.

Position Summary: In partnership with the Mt. Adams Institute (MAI), the National Forests of North Carolina will sponsor a VetsWork AmeriCorps intern to serve as a Forestry Technician in the Timber Management program. The Intern will directly support the mission to “sustain the health, diversity, and productivity of the Nation’s forests and grasslands to meet the needs of present and future generations” by supporting timber sale projects. With an increase of threats to natural resources, the intern will learn to manage natural resources in a sustainable manner, so that generations to come can enjoy our forests. This is a primarily field-based position with exposure to all types of weather and terrain.

Member Benefits Include:

Monthly AmeriCorps living stipend
AmeriCorps education award
Monthly housing stipend
Student loan forbearance
Basic medical insurance (covers members only; vision and dental not included).
Child care allowance for those who qualify.
Access to G.I. Bill benefits of up to approximately $2,400 per month. Actual benefits vary by individuals’ qualified benefits.
Professional development, trainings, certifications and networking opportunities.

Essential Functions (to include, but not limited to):

· Perform boundary layout for timber cutting and sales in accordance with Environmental Assessment and Forest Plan direction.

· Prepare, develop, and execute timber cruises and sample surveys to estimate quality and quantity of timber.

· Assist other functional areas such as Wildlife Biology, Recreation, Archaeology, and Fire Management with oversight from supervisor to guide in project planning.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
Service Site - Croatan National Forest

· Must have a valid driver's license, clean driving record and ability to provide documentation.

· Demonstrates independence, self-motivation, and resourcefulness.

· Ability and willingness to serve outdoors, in inclement weather, and lift up to 40 lbs. and to endure strenuous and repetitive physical activity.

· Able to take the lead on development of individual learning goals, project goals, measurable outcomes, timelines, and reporting.

· Desire to promote environmental stewardship, especially to under-served communities.

AmeriCorps

· Must have served in US Armed Forces and have a DD214 with an honorable discharge.

· At least 21 years of age at beginning of service term.

· U.S. citizen, national or lawful permanent resident.

· Possession of a high school diploma or equivalent, or commit to earning one prior to receiving education award.

· Ability to commit to the full 45-week term of service.

· Selection, placement and retention are contingent upon passing the National Sex Offender Public Registry, state of service and state of residence criminal history check and a national FBI check.

COVID-19 Policy - Selected applicants will be required to follow the policies at their service site including any changes that are implemented throughout the course of the program. These policies may include vaccination or regular testing mandates (federal sites), masking / social distancing mandates, remote / virtual work, altered field duties and other restrictions determined necessary to keep site staff, partners and the public safe. Accepting a position means accepting the current requirements and any updates to those requirements while you are enrolled in the program.

Website: fs.usda.gov/nfsnc

Project Location: Croatan Ranger District, 141 East Fisher Ave., New Bern, NC 28560

Service Dates: March 7, 2022 to January 14, 2023 (1700-hour position)

position: Intern - Indirect Marketing Analyst & Strategy - Summer 2022, Work From Home
description: ABOUT LUMEN Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies. THE ROLE Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology.  During a 10- week period (June 3, 2022- August 12, 2022) , our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time. Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace.   Interns will connect to our company culture through community outreach projects, engage with our employee resource groups and be able to develop their professional skills and business acumen through frequent exposure to senior leadership, cutting-edge technology, groundbreaking projects, and a network of mentors and fellow interns.   THE EXPERIENCE - INNOVATE – to deliver solutions to real business problems - TRANSFORM – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects - CONNECT – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. - IMPACT – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves. JOB DESCRIPTION In this role, our goal is to provide our intern with a wide exposure to Lumen products and various organizations. He/She/They will work closely with the Strategic Sales Organization (Indirect, SI, Digital Ventures & Hyperscalers), and assist with managing varied communications, social campaigns, events, incentives, marketing tools, and enablement.    MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES: - Partner Incentive competitive research and development - Assist in Partner Incentive payouts and ROI tracking - Manage marketing investment funds ROI data and tracking - Updating Partner Incentive & sales collateral - Support with marketing functions on Partner Portal   The ideal candidate is a self-starter, takes initiative, has a keen attention to detail, strong organization skills, communication skills, and maintains a professional demeanor. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS - Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in, Communications, Business Administration, or closely related field - Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university; junior or senior level education status at the start of the internship (graduating August 2022 – June 2023). - GPA: 3.0 or higher preferred - If position is in office, must have transportation to/from work daily - Must be available to work 30 – 40 hours, during the specified 10-week timeframe - Proficiency in Microsoft Office Programs, including Excel - Salesforce or other CRM experience a plus - Analytical skills - Graphic Design skills - Understanding of Project Management concepts   WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you!
